element_texts.text: Completed

EDWARD RUSSELL. WILDER S. METCALF. RUSSELL & METCALF, SUCCESSORS TO EDWARD RUSSELL, DEALERS IN FARM MORTGAGES AND WESTERN SECURITIES, SAFE AND PROMPT. Send for Circulars. Lawrence, Kans., March 16 1892 Dear folks. Wi told me that next month he would give me a ten dollar bill besides my board. Wi has to travel around a good deal. He says they intend to inspect every piece of property that they have anything to do with at least once a year. Last week he was in Greenwood co three or four days, and he went there again last night to be gone the rest of the week probably. Besides Monday night he went to Topeka on business of the "Lake View Shooting and Fishing Ass." of which he is Secretary. The ass. has just been organized and has leased a lake 5 miles west of here and will stock it with trout and are going to have it for their own amusement and keep everybody else out. The lake is an old river bed of the Kansas river. R and M own about 75 farms I think and then rent them for what they can get. They are all rented except a few perhaps which are worked on shares. Most of them dont any more than pay taxes and expenses if they do that. If they had a man to look after them and tend to them I should think they could
Completed

Harry - 1892 Kansas Mar. '92 Harry
work them so as to make it pay some. I heard Wi dictate a letter to you and Charley which sounded as if it meant something as to getting a man to tend to them. I have heard John G. Wooley at Oberlin. He told a wonderful story of his experience. What was the entertainment of the C. E. Society? Ralph's long letter was the stuff. My washing is done with Wi's & Mary's except my shirts + collars + cuffs which I take to the laundry. I have darned two stockings and shortened up the sleeves in one of those new white shirts. I do not belong to the Choir. It is a quartette Choir, not an extra good one either. When either the Bass or the Tenor is away Wi takes his place. He has sung Tenor two Sundays since I came, and he is much better than the regular tenor, although he is more of a Bass than a tenor isn't he. I do not teach a S.S. class. I go in a class taught by J.G. Haskell the architect. I go to the weekly prayer meeting and don't take part. 
Keyes, thank you for your letter. Here is a kiss for you. 
Well good day
Harry.
Completed

Reynolds' Consecutive." 413
Book No.
From Henry Martyn Metcalf 18
To Journal, Dec. 31, 1896 - Nov. 14 1898.
Patented June 22, 1875
Completed

1897
Took load of apples potatoes etc to Oberlin Dec 28.
Harold here Dec. 25-8
Dec 31 96 Thurs. Very warm. Eli + I to Hill lot picked up spring wagon full of apples. Hands not cold. Prayer Meetg. Dr. Sherwood led A + A + family her. Marguerite also to dinner.
Jan 1. Many many presents, "list attached" crossed out, P.M. split some wood. Loughey? + Foote here eve. Geo Rich + family here. read Golden Rule.
Jan 2 Sat. Marion Roots birthday 1 yr old. a.m. Joe Eli + I to woods. cut my foot with axe. muddy. warm. skipped choir mtg. Minnie went home. her step father sick.
Jan 3 Sun. Rev Milton Norton 94 OC preached. Text a.m. Col: 3.3 your life is hid in X in God " p.m. mk 10:45 The Son of Man came not to be ministered unto but to minister. Churchill led Choir. I started in as Supt of SS on Lake Ave. Attendance 20. warm. muddy Meri Lickarish led CE.
Jan 4 damp rain Mon. a.m. Joe + I shelled lot of corn. Marion + I to Geo. Rich's for sour milk. A + A + family went back to O. and Joe with them to work in Library $10 a mo. + board. P.M. to mill for bran + mids. Got filter mended 5 cents. Even. Meetg of 1st Cong. Society unanimous call Cadmus. Then "week of Prayer" meetg good. Benton led. Saw Frank Crowell front of opera house.
Completed

Jan 5 cold wave Tues. Petunia had calf last night. Father rode down town. Paid $3.00 C.E. Social. Led meeting in eve. Jne 17
Jan 6 cold Wed. Dr. Moysey to see Petunia. Drove over to West Side to see Pat Carlin about calf. Sawed wood at home. Meetg in eve. Marion led. very good. told story of her own conversion. She had been wishing to be a Christian but did not know how. The verse "What soever ye shall ask in my name I will do it came home to her. She that "I have asked God to make me a Christian and I am one" and she got up in a meetg and said that she was. Father wrote several letters and brot them out for Marion to add a word. He told in the letters about his heart trouble.
Jan 7 little warmer Thurs. Used Petunias milk at home. One teat gives no milk. Father rides to town every morning. Cant walk much. P.M. banked up hen house a little. Geo R brot load of wood.
Completed

Prayer meet. (J. Schaible leader) and teachers meetg.
Friday warmer Jan 8. Separated cow + calf. Got 150 lb bran at mill. balance of what father payed for long ago. P.M. worked some on debate. Geo. brot 2 loads of wood. Lincoln Club. Eli + I debate Resolved that lawyer justified in defending a client he knows to be guilty as charged. Was appointed chairman Program Com.
Sat warmer fair thawing Jan 9 Ralph's birthday. a.m. put wood in cellar. p.m. Father Eli Ike and I to woods. Jud Stacking took away calf. paid 50 cents for it. Eve. delivered SS invitations for Marion. Choir meetg. Jo home on eve. train.
Sun. warm chill breeze good roads Jan 10. Rabbit's making nest. Not go to Church. SS.  Marions resignation as assistant supt. Fern Smith told bad stories about F. Dumas. Lake Ave. C.E. Ch. Eve. Prof. Curries on Unrecognized Blessings. (1) Life itself (2) Home life (3) Country (4) the Gospel. Text the walk to Emmans. Closing Hymn "abide with me"
Completed

Mon colder stormy wind snow Jan 11. Father walked down town rode back. Saved a little w. buck saw. P.M. to woods. piled up the wood we left on ground last Saturday finished that tree. Eve. Prayer meetg. Roy Foley led. 8 oclock. Program com. of Lincoln Club met at our house till 10:30. Joe back to Oberlin on early train this am
Tues. fair thawing in sun cold in eve. Jan 12 Father rode down walked back. Sawed split + piled wood at home a.m. and p.m. Meetg in eve. Harry Braman walked home with me. Said he had started to be a Xian and that it was all through my sister (Marion)
Wed Jan 13. Wood pile fell down in cellar. Fixed it and saved + split some. Harriet DeCapdevila to dinner. Drove Lizzie DeWitt up to Emmerts. Went to woods in p.m. Eve. home, Marion spoke at Miss. Mtg at Lorain p.m. Net went to Collinwood.
Completed

Thurs growing warmer Jan 14. annual Mtg Savings Bk. A.M. sewed old carpet to make horse blanket. p.m. wood pile at home. Eve. annual mtg. of Church. Father rode to it. Teachers' mtg. Mr. Cadmus formally accepts.
Fri warmer fair Jan 14 Horse loose in barn last night. Wasted much time. Wood pile some. Eli helps very much in care of cows. Petunia does well, gives good mess of milk. kicks not much. In eve. called on John Tite. Prayer mtg. Minah Standen led. Lincoln club. Gates came home with us after club. Net returned from Collinwood. May Rich is getting up surprise for Geo. birthday
Sat. warm cloudy Jan 16 A.M. wood pile at home. I saw Eli + RBF split. P.M. Father, Eli, Ike, Ralph Fay, and I went to woods Eve. Choir mtg.
Sun. stormy cleared off + clouded up again several times thunder showers very warm Jan 17. Morning service. Prof Currier Phil. 4:8 "Think on these Things" Sub. "Good Thinking" S.S. Becker + Tite back in S.S. 7 boys present. Secy report for last quarter last year. Max. attend. 276 average 228 Did not go to Lake Ave. on acct jail meetg. Mr. Stocking spoke at jail. was here to dinner. 9 male folks went to jail. no ladies. G.E. mtg. led by Salv. Army.
Completed

Capt Maschal (?) + wife. Invited the choir to G. Richs surprise party. Called on Penniman (sick abed with malaria) after evening service. Then to Salv. Army. Marion went to Ridgeville in eve. Elyrian Quar. met at C. Crehores at 2 p.m.
Mon much colder snow Jan 18 Coal oil bbl filled after driving down town to father, went around + invited rest of choir. Piled wood. P.M. shelled corn. Father went to Ridgeville to Farmers Mkt. Eve. Social Committee. Personal Wk Class and met father at 9:30.
Tues cold. Jan 19 Monkeyed a good deal over George's party. Got some corn ground in the p.m. 5 bushels or so. Party a great success. the choir turned out in full force. Bed 12 stand Geo. completely surprised.
Wed. warmer snow thawing at night 20. Took laundry to soild clothes P.M. pick over apples in cellar. eve. Concert. Mozart Symphony Club.
Completed

Jan 97
Thurs. colder 21 Sam Clark to dinner. Marion to Oberlin. Minnie came back. her mother turned her out of the house. Wood pile. SS lesson a while after dinner. Skated to town on side walk in eve. Quartet practice 7. Teachers mtg 8.
Fri wind snow 22 Father had a spell at 5 A.M. about waked up after little more than half hour. Was up to breakfast 9 rode to Town. Got laundry from Chinamen. $1.50 P.M. to woods alone. Eve. home. played Geog. cards. S.S. lesson. E.W. + wife home from Clifton Springs in P.M.
Sat colder 12 degrees in a.m. 23 Aunt Anna had stroke of paralasis at 7 A.M. Took Father + Marion down there and did errands w. horse + buggy all the A.M. P.M. chopped corn fodder etc. Choir mtg. Aunt Anna died 10 P.M.
Sun. cold snow much 8 or 10 in. Coldest day so far 24. Currier preach. Dan. 6:10 Windows open toward Jerusalem. We should have windows for our souls, to let in good influences, from (1) nature (2) books (3) home life (4) religion "Lift thine eyes." If we keep our windows closed we are like a miser who having great wealth lives in squalor: starve our souls.
Completed

at S.S. Will Young said his gloves were taken from his pocket at S.S. last Sunday. Did not go to Lake Ave. on account of storm and laziness. C.E. Theate Faxon led (?) Eve. Service Newcombe solo. Currier. Text Jo. 14.1 "Let not your heart be troubled: (1) believe in God (2) believe also in me." (1) in God. not an intellectual belief but trust in God as our father. Many have a secret unrecognized unbelief. The Psalms full of genuine trust in God. stories? to faith. Ps. 20. 23. 91. according as we believe in this care of God as a father will be our peace. "Thou wilt keep etc" (2) also in me. (a) only by faith in X is faith in God perfected + sustained. Light is a symbol of God. but light must have a medium. That is a symbol of God. That must be expressed by a word. X is the word. (b) faith in X changes our relation w God enemies. - reconciled. guilt - forgiveness sin - redemption. (c) only faith in X realize Power of Holy Spirit "thee that believe in me the works that I do etc." Only by faith in God can you have a tranquil heart If you would have a sustaining faith in God you must believe in X.
Completed

Jan 94
Mon. coldest yet 10 degrees below or more coldest weather in 25 yrs. 25 A.M. took Father to Aunt Anna's Then took Miss Jennie Hall there. Spent rest of morning mending mittens. Uncle E.W. and Irving here. P.M. read "Field, Dungeon + Escape" till 2. Shelled corn. Black cow had chill. Eve. Quartette practice. Telephone office nit.
Tues cold 26. Aunt Anna's funeral 2:30 p.m. A+A here. DeWitt Gaylord. Quartette practise in eve.
Wed cold snow some 27 Hydrant frozen + burst pipe. can get no water from it. It will have to be dug up. McCormick the plumber came up to see it. Copied some music. In p.m. pump in kitchen froze + it took Net and I 2 hours or so it thaw it out. Eve. Quartette Prac. at Philpotts Hamilton not there Geo. P gave me a box of salve for my foot. Skinned my face a little driving under apple tree today.
Thurs colder yet, snow 28 Copied music. Quartette met 11 a.m. at store. P.M. monkeyed till 2 reading Independent Chopped corn-stalks many. Shelled corn little Frank Vincent at Prayer Mtg. Teachers Mtg. called at Plochers on way to mtg.
Completed

Fri. Jan. 29' 1897. a little warmer Father's birthday 15 yrs. old When I drove down town with Father I went to 9:10 train to meet Annie but she did not come. Quartette prac. at 11:00 at shoe store. shell some corn. Geo. brought load of wood. Eve. home. had a slight sore throat Eli had a Critique at Lincoln Club mock trial.
Sat 30 warmer, but not thaw A.M. started to dig up hydrant Ground frozen about 4 inches deep. P.M. Father Eli + I to woods. While there Uncle Eliab + Aunt Mallie rode into woods in cutter. Geo. hauled a load. Good sleighing all this week. Eve. Choir mtg. Choir talked of having a sleigh ride to Dover next Monday night Jo home in eve. Bought pair mittens leather, .25
Sun 31 10 below zero in early A.M. Thawing in middle of day. Bright sun Only 3 boys at S.S. Young, Murbach + Vincent. Lake Ave. rode out in old bob sled. picked up Will Young + he went out with me. C.E. Exec. Com. meetg at 4:45 Currier preached in A.M/ on "His mother made him a little coat from year to year" In P.M. on We all with unveiled face beholding etc.
Completed

Mon. Feby 1 warm 1 inch snow last night not thawing much Jo went back to Oberlin early train. Wood-pile some. Chopped bones for chickens Quartette practice at 3:45 and 7:30 P.M. Hair cut Wynn's - - .15 Called on Lizzie DeWitt in kitchen. Soapstones.
Tues 2 warm hazy Ground hog day. Xian Endeavor Day. A.M. put wood down cellar. P.M. Sung at funeral of Dan Wright FH Smith took Ham's place. Rev. Knapp preached: Plain talk on saloon question. Finished digging up hydrant. Quartette practice 6:30 Bough linen collars 15 rubber cement 10
Wed 3. warm. snow some Pile wood down cellar in a.m. P.M. Plummer fixed hydrant. Filled in the dirt again. Eve. Maccabee Entertainment. Quartette sang. Father has attack of Gall stones Doctor here all night. although pain stopped just after he retired.
Thurs. 4. warm bright. Wood pile. Father + I to cemetary after dinner to superintend burial of Aunt Annas remains. Eve. Preparatory lecture by Currier. Text the alabaster box of ointment. C.E. Union Exec. Com. Plan for Annual Mtg.
Completed

Fri. Feby 5 1897 warm rain hard at 10 P.M. Met Mrs. Parmelee of Turkey and her daughter Ruth (11 or so) at 9 oclock train. They here to dinner. She spoke at Miss. mtg at Mrs. Garfords house. Took Lizzie DeWitt a bug. potatoes 4 Oct. Nelson + Eugene Crell went with me. Wood pile some. Eve. Lincoln Club. Mock trial.
Sat. Feb 6 rain all last night. end of sleighing Picked over all the apples in the little cellar Ike & Fowls & Eli & I. (Keyes) Nelson Murback & Arnold delivered 1110 lbs bran. Choir mtg.
Sun. Feb 7 warm slippery Communion service. Currier. Harry Braman joined church. New boy in SS class Will Roe. Everard went to Lake Ave for me. Eli did chores. went to Fields [[in?]. Quartette. sang 5 pieces. entertained at J.T. Robinson
Mon Feby 8 colder. reads splendid for wheeling. Took grist 4 bus corn to Reublin's mill P.M. wood pile. Father split some eve. Personal Work Class. Marion led.
Tue. 9. cold Got crosscut saw back from Geo He has had it gutted new.
Completed

Geo. smoking hams. Eli + I sawed with it after school. Home in eve. Read Farrar Life of Christ. Net had her Fortnightly Essay "Sanitation" cloudy
Wed 10. cloudy Home all day + eve. Chopped pumpkins. Wood pile. "Paper" in eve. Saw a robin today.
Thurs. 11th cloudy Finished up all the wood there was hauled. Net + Father rode to Oberlin. Dr Sherwood led pr. mtg. Teachers mtg. Stopped in at Catholic Ch on way home. big crowd. lectures to non-catholics.
Fri. 12th. cloudy Lincolns birthday. A.M. stood in line 1 hr for seats at Watterson lecture. Piled wood. P.M. Lincoln Club extempore program. Genevra Johnstone Bishop at our Church. 
Sat 13th. some sunshine Heard a Kingfisher. heard one last December. A.M. chopped corn stalks shelled corn mended sled. P.M. Father Eli Ike & I to woods. cut down big leaning maple. Choir meeting.
Completed

Sunday Feb. 14 1897, bright + clear warm, thawing much Mr. Cadmus' first Sunday. He is our valentine. Church very full. beautiful flowers, roses, callas, etc. Choir sang "Brightest + best of the sons of the morning" Text Rom 8:17 "If so be that we suffer with him that we may be also glorified with him" Had 9 boys in S.S. Cadmus made splendid talk to S.S. Lake Ave. 16 present no organist. Gates MG. led jail mtg for me. Annual Mtg C.E. Union. I was elected Pres. Eve. Sermon. I Cor 2:2. good Trio. Protect us through coming night.
Mon. Feb. 15 thawing A.M. took butter to Lizzie DeWitt. Then up to Geo. Rich's to cut ice. cut from Geo's pond in A.M. and from river P.M. Eve. Pers. wk class. Marion led. Baptists + Methodists have had revival since wk of pray
Tues. 16 thawed much, sunshine Cutting ice. Geo's to dinner. F Freeman, Walter Hadaway + I worked at river, Geo. hauled. Will Jerome and Mr. Walters packed. Ice very rotten in P.M. Eve. Henry Watterson's lecture on Abraham Lincoln.
Completed

Wed Feb 17 very warm mud getting deep. A.M. shelled some corn. Florence Putnam came from Oberlin. She is going home giving up college course on acct of her deafness. P.M. went to call on ministers to talk about suppressing an immoral show. did not find them at home. saw Norrie Thayer, just out of work-house, where he was sent for cruel treatment of horse probably when he was drunk. I wrote to him and sent him "Daily Bread" as New Years present. Wrote notes to 3 of the ministers. eve. Took Mr. Benton down to Lake Ave. C.E. mtg. 3 there besides us. Geo + May Rich here to supper. Geo + Father annual settlement.
Thurs. 18. springy maple sugar weather A.M. got my watch fr. Bickford &1.25 P.M. cleaned privy. Eve. prayer meeting. Cadmus. Father spoke about show pictures, Levagood replied. Eli Nette + Florence Putnam went to hear the Bell ringers Robin.
Completed

Fri. Feb 19 97. maple sugar weather A.M. measured aunt Anna's lot. shelled corn. studied S.S. lesson P.M. Took whipped cream to Penniman (been sick all this year) Went to woods alone. Split wood. Eve. Lincoln club. 3 Robins. Bluebird. Perhaps also Song Sparrow
Sat 20. rain A.M. took grist of corn to Reublens mill Eli + I started to woods but roads so bad we only went to Geo's + got the saw. Studied S.S. lesson. P.M. Sang at funeral of Mrs. Andrew Fowl. Mr. Cadmus. Robins Dug some parsnips, salsify, leeks + celery Roy Foley came + talked about CE while we did chores. Choir. got prescription for Florence P. at Eadys
Sun. 21 cloudy snow in eve. A.M. Sermon. Cadmus. Josh. 5:12 "The manna ceased on the morrow after they had eaten of the old corn of the land." Ten boy in SS. Class. Geo Crandale + Jno Tike. All but Lozier and Roe. Walked to Lake Ave. taught class of Little girls Miss Sears taught Bible Class. Stayed to supper at Chas. Miller's. led YPSCE mtg. Talk w. Percy Stecock. Walk home. Foot all well from axe cut.
Completed

Mon. Feby. 22 cloudy warm Washingtons Birthday A.M. patched my rubber boots. Net & Florence making nut cakes for fortnightly which Net + Bess Haines entertain this P.M. P.M. Sang at funeral of Mrs. M.M. Todd at Meth. Ch. Then called on Penniman. He was down stairs. Sewed buttons 5 on my pants. Eve. home. Robins heard almost constantly. Probably same one stays around here. Sometimes hear 2 at once.
Tues. 23 clearer colder very windy at night. Brought home sugar from store and some old pictures from Lizzie DeWitts. Grace Gaylord there. Read up on Lincoln for my Lincoln club paper. Eve. at home. "The paper" Washington Birthday edition Candy. Marion went to Cleveland today to see Hampton Troupe.
Wed 24 clear colder froze solid A.M. took Marion + Florence to 11:27 train to Oberlin. . . to pack up for home. Marion to get things for Jno. & Carrie who are going to housekeeping at Talladega. Someone moving into parsonage. P.M. chop stalks. shell corn. Lincoln paper. Eve. Father & Marion to Chapel to supper C.E. business mtg. plotted out. Eli + I stopped at Meth. Ch. Revival mtg.
Completed

Thurs. Feb 25 1897 colder snow squalls A.M. worked on Lincoln essay. P.M. Father and I to woods. Folks on our road hauling cinders on cinder path. Eve. prayer mtg "Serving our generation" Teachers meeting. Christian Citizenship committee meeting.
Fri. 26 colder snow squalls Wrote Lincoln paper all day. read it at Club in eve. Ellis Wurts came home with me after club and I turned over to him the Secy + Treas books of CE Union. Sent Express bundle to John. Amer. Ex. Co. Geo. hauled small load wood.
Sat. 27 cold clear. cold in bed. A.M. put wood in cellar. study SS. P.M. Father Eli Ike + I to woods. Geo. hauled big load. Eve. Choir. new books. Joe came home.
Sunday 28 cold. snow some A.M. Cadmus. Phil. 3:13 14 "forgetting things behind" Pastor spoke at length about Home Mission Callee? next Sunday. P.M. Walked Lake Ave. John Drottoff came back with me to Supper. CE Consecration Mtg and church. Eve. sermon on CE Topic from what does Christ save us. New hymn books
Completed

Mon. March 1st 1897 warmer sprinkle not freeze at night Jo went back A.M. Met Miss Jos. Walker at train. Missionary girl from Oberlin. Spoke to boys + girls in chapel at 3:30 P.M. P.M. To woods alone. Told Hadaway to tap trees on shares. Eve. Called in Carl Plocher, Chas Reese, Will Young Ogden Rae and Jn. Tite. Talked with Mr. Tite about Sunday closing.
Tues. Mar. 2. warm snow much 4 in. Dr Witts appraisal. New Suit at Globe Clothing Co 7.65 box Linene Collars .20 Picked out potatoes 4 bus, apples 3 bus, parsnips salsify turnips etc.to take to Annies. Eve. C.E. Business meetg. 18 present. I was Secy pro tem. GM. G subscribe for Our Union .25
Wed. 3 rained last night. snow all gone. turned cold. Took load to Oberlin. started 9 A.M. Oberlin 11:30 home 2:15 to 4:30 Baby not well. but could tell what a cow says, also sheep, cat, dog, goose duck. Eve. home.
Thurs 4. clear warm Inauguration day Keyes has Chicken Pox Worked at wood pile. Thurs eve mtg. good. Prayer for the new administration. Dr. Sherwood told a great story. 26 men from his little
Completed

village in Vt. enlisted in war. Their mothers wives and sisters formed a praying band to pray God to take care of them. Their regiment left Washington, forced marches night + day for 7 days, arrived at Gettysburg evening of first day of battle, was in the fight 3 days and then met Picketts charge. All 26 returned home safe and without a scratch. Teachers meeting. There is much talk about Aunt Annas will; not leaving Jennie Hall anything. Robins. Bluebird.
Mar. 5. Fri. rain hard in A.M. Ethels Birthday A.M. To Geo. Rich's to get saw, axes + feed cutter sharpened. Two Song Sparrow singing in the rain. Goldfinch singing. P.M. pick over apples. Eve. Lincoln club. Lee Day called at 43.
Mar 6 Sat. mud fearful A.M. Eli + I Saw wood at home. P.M. + Father + Ike to woods. Bluebirds Eve. Shoes mended 15 Choir mtg. New platform in front. apples. Crehore + Hamilton. Fathers medicine.
Sund Mar 7. colder We took our Amaryllis to Church 4 blossoms on it. A.M. not go to Ch. study SS.
Completed

All my SS boys present but Frank Dumas. Teachers meeting after S.S. $100 behind. Rode to Lak Ave 23 present. Song Sparrow. C.E. mtg. Eve. Service Political address by Pastor, Mr. Leonard + Levagood choir in front. on new platform. fair.
Mon Mar. 8 rain in p.m. thunder A.M. took clothes to washerwoman. Looked up material for temperance meeting. Net went to Oberlin. P.M. split wood. Eve. Quartette practice. Called on Gates G?.
Tues. Mar 9. very warm. rain. Great bird wave Many robins Ike saw 7 perched together. Before have not seen but two at once. Meadow Lark. Blackbirds numerous. A.M. called on Uncle Eliab for Temperance statistics. P.M. monkeyed. Stevel brought 2  bbl sugar. mended rubber boot again. eve. Program Com. of Club at Thomas'. Minnie Allen here. Eli + Net went to woods. ground nut abundant. Hepaticas budded.
Wed. Mar 10 fair warm A.M. called on F. C. Eldred, Co. Treas. Office, Clayton Chapman, Levi Morse. P.M. split wood some. made cover for pork crock. filled up hole by hydrant. Eve. Levi Morse + Livy Jones
Completed

Thurs March 11 1897 fair warm A.M. Took nets' Hepaticas to Louise Smith Father + Marion went to Surprise Dinner Party, Aunt Albinas 50th Wedding Anniversary P.M. shell corn some. eve. after prayer mtg practised song for C.E. Temperance Meeting.
Fri. Mch 12 turning windy, cloudy, colder. took grist of corn to Reubliner. Monkeyed making box trap. Studied on CE Topic. Express Jo's coat. Eli set out some onions. Crocuses out. Lincoln Club. 10 present. Eli gave Current events. Old house of Obills burned last night.
Sat 13 cold night fair day warm A.M. Eli + I saw at home. P.M. all 4 of us to woods Ike walked up. eve. home. Song sparrows. Meadow Larks. Robins Blk birds Boys have tapped trees at wood lot on shares.
Sunday 14 very windy dad not go to church. S.S. Lake Ave. Roy Foley went down with me. He lead C.E. meeting at Lake Ave. and I on River Road. Supper at Nortons. moonlight Marion went to jail meeting where Newcombe and Emmert spoke. 
Mon. 15. fair. cold. A.M. split wood. Letter from J Leadingham P.M. Sang at funeral old Mrs. Cogswell.
Completed

March
Cora baker called at 43. eve. Practice temperance song at Nevins'. then Quartette at Philpott's office.
Tues. 16 Fair. cold. Heard a Mourning Dove A.M. rode over to W A M S Co to see Levagood. Split wood. P.M. to woods alone. swung mall for 2 1/2 hrs. Many birds. Robins abundant, woodpeckers hairy, nut hatches, one Red Breasted nuthatch, Song Sparrows, Meadow Larks. Bluebird one, small flock of Crow blk birds Red Wings and Cow birds at Geo. Rich's (went there to get him to haul manure. Think I heard some Cedar birds. Eve Quartette practice.
Wed 17. good apples on ground in orchard Rain in P.M. cold A.M. Geo. Rich came to haul manure and plow. south strip of garden. Bought new dung fork didn't pay for it 50 Father went to auditors office to get statistics for me for temperance meeting. eve. practise at Nevins'. Marion went of Lake Breeze to Missny Mtg.
Thurs. 18 warm. drizzly. clearing some in P.M. A.M. helped Geo. Rich take 2 cows to Pember's. P.M. statistics. Heard Mourning Dove. eve. Quartette. not prayer mtg. Leadingham has a teaching job "in sight" for me at Honolulu.
Fri 19 very warm. rain. Heard a male Chewink in grove and found him by following the sound. Mourning Dove
Completed

Fri. Mar. 19 1897 A.M. took some parsnips to town to sell. Geo. Rich here all day tinkering. P.M. statistics. Eve. Quartette sang at Concert benefit of Choir at Ridgeville. Harry Marshall complimented me. Answered Leadinghams letter. said I might consider favorably.
Sat 20. fair. warm. April shower at sunset then clear off again. Sang at Mrs. Pattersons funeral. Quartette. Eli + Ike went to West woods for Fairy Shrimps but it is too late. Sat up till 12 pm painting statistics on big sheets of paper.
Sunday 21 fair warm beauty SS. Lake Ave. 4 visitors from town Miss Sears, Cobb, Edith Hecock + Fleda Rolling. got off my statistics there as well as at CE Temperance meeting Good mtg. Marion and Eli to Lake Ave CE Temp. Mtg. Ch. eve. service. full house. Sermon on Unity.
Mon 22 warm. shower in A.M. cloudy Put up bars to shut cows out of grove Cleared away broken part of semi-circle arbor. Kinglets in grove Quartette 8 P.M.
Tues 23. colder. snow-rain then warmer Flock of Cedar Waxwings.
Completed

March
Dug some parsnips + washed them. Wrote report of C.E. Jail Committee. C.E. business meeting + social and Quartette practice in eve.
Wed. 24. little colder, very stormy, snow squalls. Tried to sell a basket of parsnips + could not. shelled corn. got sack Graham flour 1.25 New kitchen girl. Rose Howe. Monkeyed with Harolds microscope in eve.
Thurs. 25 colder. mud ground white with snow. Will Nevins papering 2 rooms Whipped carpet etc. Nelson fainted in school. Went over West side for a woman to clean house. Prayer mtg. + Teachers mtg. Mary Wi here from Wellington + went back again.
Fri 26. fair cold A.M. snow some eve. dug parsnips. down town for picture moulding. P.M. helped Geo Rich move furniture from DeWitts. Junior Ex Eli Nette + Ike went. Nevins papering. Saw Chippy.
Sat 27 fair cold cloudy in P.M. Helping Geo. move Dewitt stuff, Lizzie moved up to our house stomach ache again from lifting. had it before last fall. Bed 6 P.M. Mayo home eve. train.
Sun. 28 fair springy Up at 10:30. Mayo taught my SS. Class. lay around all day. Dr. Sherwood said I pretty near had a rupture.
Completed

Monday Mar 29 1897 fair. springy. Joe back to O. Eli do chores + help Geo. at DeWitts. Vacation Monkey at Harmony of Gospels. Made chopsticks for "Little Helpers" Chinese Tea. Grace Gaylord paid me Saturday 50 Ohio Liquor Laws 15
Tues. 30 fair beaut day A.M. finished packing books at DeW. Eli hauled wood + coal from there home. P.M. Eli + I took books to depot 3 boxes for Oberlin Library. Eli worked all day hauling stuff. I monkeyed on Harmony of Gospels. Eve. home.
Wed 31 fair A.M. took 10 bus. Rural NY Potatoes to Curtis 25 cts bu. P.M. cleaning up truck. Eli waited on table at chapel supper. Riches at 43 in eve. 
Thurs. April 1st fair. chill wind Eli + Ike walked to Oberlin Met Mrs. C.A. Clark (Hattie Gulick) + her 2 sons at depot + took them to Aunt Albina's. shelled corn for a grist. Sang at funeral of old Chas. Brown. I have bad cold Teachers mtg. Boys stayed over night at O
Fri. 2nd clouding up. wind. A.M. Took some onions to Richs
Completed

Brot load of apple limbs from Hill lot for fire wood. Good apples on ground there. P.M. Father Keyes Nelson + I to wood lot orchard trimming trees + burning brush. Worden boy brot out a jug + 2 glass jars of maple syrup our share. Eli + I arrived from Oberlin afoot 3 pm Lincoln Club in eve. Throat sore. Letter from Leon Flint. Phoebe Juncos
Sat 3 fair beautiful A.M. Eli + I to Wood lot. Eli hauled load of wood + then came up + helped trim trees. Keyes + Nelson + Marion Benton. Robin building. P.M. 12 bus. potatoes to Curtis. Net went to Oberlin to stay couple months. Eli + Ike tired from yesterdays walk.
Sun 4 sprinkle in A.M. clear off at night. Church. sat with Frank Dumas. Communion. Lake Ave. Smithkons there. attendance 14. C.E. Church.
Mon 5 threatening. City Election. School begin Nelson promoted A.M. saw up apple limbs Sparrows breeding P.M. trim trees. dig parsnips. Vote. Eve. program committee at Chapel. Lincoln C.
Tues. 6 threatening. Robin building in old wren box A.M. carried ashes out of cellar filled wagon. P.M. hauled ashes to Hill lot. eve. home. S.S. lesson.
Wed. 7. threatening. Finished ashes. put the rest in orchard.
Completed

Thursday April 8. 1897. cloudy. cool. rain at Eve. Dug leeks and parsnips Read "Titus". Prayer meeting and teachers meeting Father stayed to church committee mtg. Cadmus wanted free seats + committee voted it. 
Friday 9. snowing. ground covered. windy not freezing. Picked over few apples in cellar. Chopped much corn fodder. shelled some corn. eve. Lincoln Club I had critique. Election of officers. President, Thomas.
Sat. 10 pretty fair. snow all melted in P.M. A.M. Eli + I worked for Lincoln Club. Move up stairs. P.M. Took 10 bus. potatoes of Curtis 32 bus. in all so far. Then pick over apples in cellar kids shell beans. Eve. home.
Sun. 11 stormy, snow. A.M. Cadmus preached on "Free seats" and "Every day Church" Deut 12:5-6 and Mark 14:49 Only 4 boys in S.S. Went to jail meeting instead of Lake Ave. To Miss Sears' to ask her to lead a Sunrise meeting on Easter. C.E. Mtg. Missionary program Union Temperance Mtg in our Ch. Mrs. Plumb + Revs Jovell + Cadmus
Mon 12. pretty fair weather. A.M. trim trees. P.M. wasted copying music. Patent Medicine. Eve practice Nevins
Completed

April
Ike to Oberlin on 5 ocl. Train.
Tues. 13 warmer. south wind. rain at eve. Keyes birthday. Ike home early train. A.M. shelled corn (with Gene Crell) P.M. to mill. burned bush. Eve. meeting at Chapel Passion week. Practice Nevins'
Wed. 14 colder. cloudy, trim trees. Ike has Pink Eye. Purple Martin 1.
Thurs. 15 warmer, fair. Crisp fixed Eave Trough 2 Purple Martins 1. Ruby Crowned Kinglet. heard him sing + came out of barn to see who he was. Finally saw his crown flash in the sunlight. Ike went to woods in A.M. Trim trees. P.M. to Geo. Rich's help get apples out of cellar. Prayer mtg + Teachers mtg. Ike saw Winter Wren Church voted unanimously for Free Seats.
Fri. 16 local showers colder. wind S.W. A.M. hauled manure w. G. Rich one load from Kelsey's to Hill lot. 2 from Geo's barn yard. P.M. cut up apple limbs. Eve. Lincoln Club. G.C. Kinglets abundant.
Sat. 17 cold. stormy. Robins nest 3 eggs in old Wren box see April 6. Brown creeper goes spirally up tree trunk. always flies to foot of tree. R.C. Kinglets song reminds me of Vireo. G.C. Kinglets. A.M. Looked up S.S. boys. Crandall Vincent Young Tite + Becker. with horse.
Completed

p.m shell beans with kids. Cleared off at night.
Sunday April 18 1899 Easter. Clear beautiful.
Father sick in the night
frosty morning. South wind warming up.
Sunrise Meeting 6 a.m.
Late to church and could not find a seat all full
went to Methodist. S.S. all boys present except Crandall. New boy Art Jendroio.
Lake Ave. only 8 present. Called at Frank Luther
on way back. C.E. not Ch.
LeMaster here in eve.
Swallows (barn I think) Kinglets G.C. and R.b.
Mon 19 colder colder north wind. fair somewhat.
Cut down cherry tree in front yard.
Tues. 20. very hard frost. fair.
a.m. cut up cherry tree. Lizzie LW. to Cleveland
p.m. Father and I to wood lot trim hedge.
Kinglets both kinds. chewink.
Net here. to Fortnightly back to Oberlin.
White-throated Sparrows several. whistle.
Robin's nest 2 eggs in Fulton pear tree.
Eve. C.E. business mtg. and Extorsion social.
Wed 21 warm. fair.
a.m. Bureau of Lizzie's from freight depot. Mend
fence behind barn. Manure the asparagus bed
p.m. Father and I to wood lot. Father spread manure
I piled up hedge brush and grabbed up young poplars
eve. First Cong. Society plans for new Institut. Church
and free pews. Quartette practice at Crehore's
Lincoln Club program Com. at Gardner's room.
Swallows. Brown Creeper. White throated Spar.
RC Kinglets Woodlot white with Spring-beauty. acres
Completed

apl.
Thurs. 22 Apl. 97 fair. warmest day yet summer like.
White crowned sparrow. Juncos. Chimney swifts.
Spread manure at hill lot all day.
Prayer mtg and teachers mtg. Marion has pink-eye.
Lu Twiss Shepard? died of Pneumonia
Hair cut crossed-out "borrowed of Eli" 15
Fri 23 fair warm. heavy shower in evening.
Buds starting on apple trees. a.m. dug leeks
p.m. to funeral of Lu Shepard. Mary West.
here to attend. Coal oil bbl. filled.
eve. Lincoln club.
Sat 24 fair warm. 80 degree House Wrens here.
Geo. Rich here hauled manure and finished plowing
the garden. Planted potatoes 5rows on
South west side of south strip.
Eli and Fay to south woods in a.m. got White adder tongues
White Trillium. Red Trillium. Cucularia both kinds.
Jack in the Pulpit Buttercups. Rue Anemone. Bitter cresses
Eve. home. S.S. lesson. Lizzie back again.
Sun 25 Rain.
apple leaves half grown. Vireos several
cherry blossoms beginning.
Cadmus preached on Institutional Church. S.S. discouraged.
Afternoon at home. Gates and Roy called at 5. "Tenth Legion"
Consecration mtg. Evening sermon on Abraham.
Mon 26 changeable. colder. Bluets and Dandelions in pasture
1 Baltimore Oriole male. 1 Yellow Warbler
Purple Finches small flock males and females.
White Throated sparrows G.C. Kinglets
a.m. Plant potatoes in garden N.W. part S. Strip.
p.m. Plant peas N.E. part S strip.
Bute has a great swelling on belly.
Completed

April 1897
Tues 27.  fair.  frost.  Father has terrible lame back  Lumbago.  Got up at 9 oclock.  can hardly move.  Planted early beets, peas, beans + sweet corn in E end N strip.
along the side: Baltimore orioles, yellow Warblers
eve. to DeWitt house to help Geo.  
Quartette practice.  Cora Baker gone home sick
Wed 28 fair warmer.  Wood Thrush singing  Father little better.  up early, rode down town 
a.m. trim trees.  
p.m. mend fence at wood lot.
eve. L.C. Program Com. and Quartette practice
H.W. Ingersoll loaned me Revised Statutes
Cows in pasture in p.m.  Beets + carrots all gone.
Thurs 29  cloudy.  warm.  Bobwhite.  Cat bird.  White thrt sparrows
mend fence all day.  In p.m. Father went up + sowed Alsyke seed and walked back.
eve.  Wm. Sherwood led meetig.  Teachers mtg.
most trees are quite green now.  leaves half grown.
Fri 30  threatening.  rain after 4 p.m.  warm.
a.m. mend fence.
p.m. out Lake Ave calling with Benton.
4p.m. Anniversary committee at Miss Sear's.
eve.  Lincoln club.
Bobwhite.  Barn Swallows sure.  Wht thrt sparrows  Wood thrush.  Blk + wht warbler?
Sat. May 1. 1897  rain rain.  Wht thrt sparrows.
chop corn stalks some.  made kindling wood out of some old chairs.  Study S.S some,
New keg nails.  Father about well.
Completed

Blk throated green warbler?
Seek no further apple tree fell over by corn-house
Sun. May 2. 1897  threatening  big rain last night
Annual Ch. Coll. for A.M.A.  Sermon on "Not as the world giveth, give I unto you' Cadmus,
S.S. better.   Lake Ave. 15 present.
Quartette practice 6 p.m.  C. E. meeting
delegates elected for Co. Conv.  Quartette sang 2 pieces as Meth. Ch. in eve.  "Sweet Sabbath Eve" and "Haven of Rest".  Sermon on "Servants" e.g. especially Eliezer of Damascus.  also Oneimus and conclusion "servants of God."
Knapp preached for Cadmus in eve.  Neuralgia.
Mon. 3  cloudy
went to wood lot stayed all day.  no dinner.  finished fence.  grubbed up poplar trees.  Heard water thrus.  Foley + Benton called in eve.
Quartette practice 7:45
Tues. 4  cloudy
a.m. Marion + I went to cemetary and got Copar to fix up Ethels grave at Harold's request.  Ordered invitations printed for Lake Ave. Anniversary
p.m. cutting up apple limbs etc.
eve. to Ridgeville  co. S.S. Conv.  Quartette sang.
Wed 5 fair
To Ridgeville Conv. all day.  Secy of Conv.  Secy of Co. S.S. assoc.  Dinner at Town Hall  Supper at J.B. Rogers'.  Father was out there in a.m.  Home at 6 p.m.  Chores.  Quartette practice at 8.
Thurs 6.  fair
a.m. plant sweet corn middle land
p.m. " potatoes E side of Flat Hill lot
Completed

eve. Quartette 6. prayer mtg 7
C.E. Exec. Com. 8.
4 Kingbirds. Heard Wood Pewee.
Green Heron.
Fri 7 May 97 fair.
a.m. plant potatoes at Hill lot
p.m. " " " for Geo Rich.
Father sowing seeds with drill at Hill lot.
Eve. Lincoln Club.
Apple and Maple leaves about fall.
Apple blossoms and Pear.
Heron. Crested Flycatcher. Cat birds.
Male Orioles. White throated Sparrows.
Sat 8 Fair. young Sparrow flown
All of us at Hill lot planting sweet corn potatoes onions carrots corn.
Geo. there plowing. at south end.
eve. to Lake Ave. to practice music.
Female oriole. heard Scarlet Tanager think. Crest Flycat.
Took the 2 heifers up to the pasture
Corn stalks gone. Cleared up old stack.
Sun. 9 big rains in p.m.
S.S. Committee meetg after.
Dinner at Philpotts Funeral of Mrs. Jos. Biggs
in Carlisle. Jail mtg. Marion and Miss Meri
Lickorish spoke. C.E. Subject Giving
Quartette sang at eve. service
Mon. 10 Fair. Red headed Woodpecker. Purple Martin
a.m. horse shod $1.20
sawed wood. Apple blossoms in glory.
p.m. cut up the apple tree that was blown down
Completed

May 97
eve. C.E. Union Exec. Com. mtg at Cadmus office.
stopped and talked with Harry Davis in tailor shop.
Tues. 11 Fair. rain in eve.
a.m. cut up apple limb.
p.m. plant corn at hill lot.
Eve. Ellis Wurts here. Quartette at 8.
Dogwood blossoms.
Rose breasted Grosbeak male and female. Wood Pewee.
Young Robin flying.
Wed. 12 cloudy. apple blossoms falling.
a.m. Shelled corn for grist. Then read up on Essay
p.m. Cleaned out privy See Feb 18 " " " " "
on Co. Commissioners.
eve. Annual Mtg of 1st Cong. Society. Old
officers and Trustees reelected. Soliciting com.
report $24,000 subscribed for new church.
Trustees put in charge of building to begin work when
in their judgement funds enough raised. Uncle
E.W. offered to give $500 within 2 years provided 4 other men would make it certain they would give.
same within 5 yrs. Rose Breasted Grosbeak.
Thurs 13 cloudy. Wrote Essay on Co. Comsrs.
nearly all day. Went to mill for grist.
eve. Quartette 6 p.m. Annual Roll Call
of Church. horrible.
Ike saw Grosbeaks. I saw Scarlet Tanager
in orchard. Humming Bird around Horse Chest
nut tree which is in blossom.
Fri. 14 Cloudy. rain early a.m.
1:21 a.m. train for Wellington. Sheriff
Lord taking prisoner to Columbus talked ov.? prisoner
Completed

Lorain Co. C.E. Conv. Wellington Cong. Ch.
Dinner at Benedicts. Supper and Night at Whitney's
bunked with young Dute from N. Amherst.
Sat. May 15. 1897 Wellington. Fair.
Sunrise meeting at 6:00.
Walked to Oberlin. 8:20 - 11:00 Nature beautiful
Flushed Snipe or Wood cock in road. Wood Pewee. Tanager
pair Indigo birds. pair Orchard Orioles.
Trillium sessile and at Blk River.
Dinner with Root family at Pa West's
p.m. Root hired me to take France to see Ball Game
Oberlin and Hiram score 7-6
Home 5 p.m. Eve. S.S. lesson.
Sun. 16 Fair. Frost in some places. not at 43
Morning sermon on II Ki. 5:13 Naaman.
S.S. Lane Ave. took Miss Levagood
out. and back and drove out again to lead
C.E. Meeting on "Things worth living for."
30 at L.A. S.S. in afternoon. Miss Bateman
there drilling primary kids in song for Annivers.
Horned Larks. Red Headed Woodpecker nest
in maple right at side of road.
Mon 17 Fair. Al. Kuchenrither helping Geo.
Worked for Geo all day. dinner there.
Father took Net to Oberlin and brot back Jo.
Chippy's nest in little Tyson pear tree.
Mourning Doves nest at Geo's. big young one,
Heron in Orchard. Crested Flycatchers nest
river bank east of Geo. potatoes. 25 ft up. in
stub of broken limb. saw bird go to nest
Completed

May 1897 with food in bill. Meadow Larks nest
6 eggs in Geo's meadow. drove right above
it hauling manure.
Eve. Anniv. Committee at Sears'.
Tues. 18 Cloudy. Sprinkle a bit
Worked for Geo. all day hauling
manure. 8 hours.
eve home.
Wed 19. Fair. warmest day yet.
a.m. Mr Stough was here and plastered
the pantry.
p.m. hauling manure from our barn
to Hill lot. last load stuck
eve. Quartette at 8:15
Thurs. 20 Rain hard in p.m.
Hauling manure. Geo. rigged pullies to
pull wagon out but had to throw off part of
load finally. Picked over some apples.
eve Prayer and teachers mtg.
Fri 21 cold. cloudy. clear off at night.
a.m. hauling manure.
p.m. spreading " " at hill lot alone.
Eve. Lincoln Club. Quartette 8:15
Sat 22 fair. frost last night. no damage here.
a.m. spread manure at Hill lot.
p.m. planting at " " all of us.
eve. To Sears' on Lake Ave. Anniv.
Ingersolls office on Co. S.S. Secy business
Mayo walked home fr. O. arr. 8 p.m.
Completed

1897
May 23 and 24 Next page by mistake
Tues. 25 cloudy.
a.m. planted new kind of potatoes E 1/2 S. land
Sawed up apple limbs.
p.m. Father and I to hill lot planting Rural NY. potatoes
on flat. and other things Eli set 2 hens.
eve. C.E. business meeting. good one.
Wed. 26 Fair. cool.
a.m. Planted corn at Hill lot W part. land and
furrowed E part (flat) for potatoes.
p.m. Father and I to Hill lot. Plant Rur. NY.
potatoes on flat land. Geo. harrowed 2
lands. and I marked them for corn.
Eve. Gates and Roy called.
Eli and I moved "White chicken coop" into pen
mowed some of grass in front yard. scythe.
Marion to supper at Chapel. Plans for new Ch.
Thurs 27 fair cool beautiful.
a.m. put away old sled. Took Lizzie up to
Aunt Albina's. Planted corn. first 2 lands
that meet the apple trees. 2 rows early potato
on flat. Harold T.H. came at noon
p.m. mowed front yard with scythe. Quartette
at 3:45. Eli and I cultivated garden.
Harold took some photographs.
Eve. prayer mtg. Nominating Com. C.E.
Mrs Cadmus played piano.
Fri. 28 warmer. rain in p.m. some.
a.m. Hill lot planted corn last 2 lands. finis.
noon. Quartette. Went over to school house to
Completed

May. see Miss Sears about Anniversary.
p.m. Cleaned out Hen House
Eve. Lincoln Club. Will Field spoke
Quartette 8:
Harold and Marion rode to O in p.m. and Net
came back with them.
Sat. 29. cloudy cool.
a.m. Co. S.S. Secy. business
p.m. pick over apples in cellar
spade border in garden.
Harold and Eli to cemetary.
Harl arrived 7 p.m. from Iowa.
Sun 30 cloudy. rain first part of p.m. clear off at night.
a.m. practise for Decoration 9:30
Memorial Day Cadmus preached on Sabbath violation. 2 Ki. 5:18
S.S. Gates' room at Halls on way home.
p.m. Lake Ave. rain. Hepler rode w. me.
26 present. practice. give out invitations.
stopped several places on way back. Crandall Ammon.
C.E. Consecration Mtg. Saw Everhard.
Cadmus preached on prayer.
Mon 31 pretty fair. Decoration Day.
a.m. Sang in Quartette at Music Hall 8:30
Wrote letter to Pa West about Anniversary. Wrote notices etc.
p.m. Mowed grass north of house. Spaded border in garden
Harold took Father Harl & Net riding.
Eve. took notices to papers. Hamiltons for camp stools
Salv. Army open air mtg. Lieut. Arthur Emery.
Tues June 1 fair
trimmed apple trees for pea brush
and poled peas. C.E. Nominat. Com. in Eve.
Completed

1897
May 23 Sunday. rain.
Meth Ch. Reeder preached on Ps. 143:8
S.S. 5 boys Stopped at Sears' on way to
Lake Ave. 28 present. Hepler rode back
with me. Stopped at Luther's.
Stella Foley gave report of Co. C.E. Conv.
Meth Ch. with Art Loughry.
Mon. 24 cloudy. rain about 5 p.m.
Mended the wire fence around chicken pen.
all. day. In eve. Quartette 6 p.m. Temperance
meeting Opera House. 7:30. Webber and P.A. Baker
replied to Geo Ely. Lincoln Club sat on platform.
Web June 2 cloudy warmer.
recd from Marion Lawrance some circulars
and mailed them to the S.S. Supts of
Lorain Co. Made some more Pea brush
Picked over apples in cellar.
Eve. Saw Pearl Lord about Union Social
Gate and I called at Will Tuckers.
Quartette at 8.
Harold left on eve. train for Chicago
Thurs 3. cloudy. warmer rain a little in a.m.
a.m. pick out 9 bus. R.N.Y. Potatoes for
Curtis the end of them.
p.m. pick out bus apples and take potatoes and apples
to Curtis. Then began cleaning out
cellar. Harl to Oberlin.
Eve. Prayer mtg. Dr. Sherwood help Mr. Cadmus lead
Completed

Fri. June 4 pretty fair cooler.
cleaning in cellar. Washed out the
little cellar clean.
Eve. Lincoln Club and Quartette.
Harl back from O.
Sat. 5 pretty fair. warmer.
a.m. cleaning in cellar etc.
p.m. all up to hill-lot. hoed beets and potatoes.
Father not feeling well. walked home. said it
hurt him to ride.
Petunias' bag swollen. milk stringy.
Sun. 6. fair
Communion. several joined church.
S.S. 23. Anniversary of Lake Ave. S.S.
big crowd.
C.E. Song Service Harl sang duet with H Davies.
Harl and Marion led Jail meeting
Mon 7 rain.
a.m. event down to Lake Ave with wagon and
brot up the camp chairs. Filed saw.
p.m. set out tomato plants and cauliflower in
garden barefoot.
Eve. Quartette 8.
Tues. 8 fair.
a.m. Sawed and split the little pile of maple wood
that was lying by cellar door.
p.m. Ground scythe at Geo.'s. Cultivated
corn south end Hill lot with Bell. Corn
only an inch of two high. It has been
so cold all the spring that everything is
backward. Corn dont grow or anything else hardly
Completed

1897
yet we have had no frosts all the spring
to do any damage. Much rain
Wed. June 9 fair.
a.m. Mowed sorrel in pasture. Then
hoed potatoes at hill lot.
p.m. " " " " " ".
Eve. Asked Fred Reeve to go to Lake Ave
and teach class of boys. said he would
C.E. business meetg. Election. Foly re-
elected pres.
Louis Sutliff married.
Thurs. 10 fair
a.m. hoed at Hill lot
p.m. mowed swath through orchard and
cultivated garden.
Eve. prayer mtg. Lincoln Club rehearsed to Mr.
Cadmus in church.
Fri 11. good shower in morn. clear off "before 11"
very warm in p.m.
a.m. monkeyed on essay etc. Net and Harl rode
to Oberlin.
p.m. S.S. lesson till 3. Mowed grass.
Very heavy crop of grass grass is only
crop that has made good growth.
Eve. Lincoln Club Public Meeting. Father went
Harl sang.
Sat 12 fair. warm. Kingbird's nest in Summer Queen tree.
left off winter flannels
Wood Pewees bldg out near Porter Tree.
Blk berries in blossom very full.
a.m. mowed in orchard They cleaned home in Father's room
p.m. hoed in garden.
Horse-less carriages here from Cleveland.
Completed

1897
Sunday June 13. Showers. Childrens Day
a.m. Cadmus preached to children Magnet and nails.
SS. small. Lake Ave. Fred Reeve went.
but no class for him. Mrs Young there.
Marion led C.E. on Bible study. Children's
concert. Keyes and Nelson sang (?) Went into
Methodist with A. Jones on way home. Gates at 43.
Mond. 14 fair. warm.
a.m. cultivated corn hill lot.
folks were mostly picking strawberries down there.
p.m. hoed " " Eli also after school.
eve. C.E. new Exec. Com. choose committees
Quartette.
Tues 15 hot. cloudy some.
a.m. hoed corn. hill lot.
p.m. went down Lake Ave. making "pastoral calls." W. Phipps, Stratton, Smith,
Washburn, Matthison, Court, Young, Wells, Miller, Johnson, Burrell, Smith, King,
Smithonz boys, Claude Roberts, Woolheater,
Biersbach boys, Gerber boy. F. Luther.
Eve. Cancus. Gates called.
Miss Swan of Des Moines here.
Wed 16 cloudy. rain at eve.
a.m. Ike and I weed onions at hill lot
p.m. same. Eli and Ike come up after school.
Eve. read Langley's Acadrome
Thurs. 17 showers.
a.m. mended pants. Sang at funeral
of Mr. Goodwin at Wm. Crisps. Drove
to Shear works to see Miss Bateman.
p.m. Mowed back of barn (over)
Completed

1897
eve. prayer meetg. Quartette. Foley's roses.
Fri. June 18. cleared off.
a.m. Roy Foley and I worked on Decorating
Committee for Alumni. went to woods
for ferns etc.
apples all gone last ones baked today.
p.m. Father and Ike and I to Hill lot. cultivated
and hoed.
Eve. Called on Beckers. Quartette at 8.
not go to Alumni mtg. all rest did. Harl
and Jo home from Oberlin.
Sat 19. big rain
a.m. cultivating Hill lot. Eli and Ike hoe.
caught in rain. came home and went in
swimming. Jo. back to O.
p.m. Monkeyed temperance lesson.
Sun. 20 cold.
a.m. Text Luke 12:19 take thine ease. fool.
Lake Ave S.S. at C. Miller's as Schoolhouse painted
31 percent. 4 classes. Fred taught boys. Gates girls.
Quartette sang "Wanted a boy". Clara Ammon visiting
and her nephew Emery Shiel rode home with us.
Stopped at Catholic Cemetary.
Miss. Mary Williams spoke at C.E. on work
at Goodrich house settlement.
Eve. text Jno 3:3 born again.
Mon 21
Long Vacation begins. Hoeing and
cultivating at Hill lot. In middle of the
morning Harold F. Hall surprised us by
suddenly appearing in a buggy with
Keyes and Nelson. On his way to North.

June
field Summer conference. Grass and weeds
very bad in spots on the flat.
John, Carrie, and Franklin arrived
home at 6:21 p.m. Father met
them at depot.
Eve. Quartette sang at Roundabouts
at Geo. Chamberlain's.
Tues. 22 fair. warmer.
a.m. Geo. mowed 6 lands at wood
lot. mostly weeds. I mowed
with scythe among trees. Kids
hoed at hill lot.
p.m. ditto about. Wild straw berries.
Uncle Herbert Brooks Aunt Jennie and Chris
here to dinner.
Net Harl John and Carrie to Oberlin
John back in p.m.
Eve. John showed us pressed flower
from Alabama. Hulled strawberries
Wed 23 fair. hot
a.m. did not go to O with John.
Quartette at 8: at Ham's store for edification
of Schubert 2. Hoed in garden S 1/2 N Land
Kids to hill lot.
p.m. All to wood lot. Raked and
cocked up hay. Wild strawberries
for supper. Never saw so many of them

Eve. Quartette at 8. called on E. Wurts.

1897
Thurs June 24 hot.
a.m. cultivated at hill lot. Kids hoed.
stopped at Rich's on way home for berries and
Jno and Harl there on bicycls
p.m. All at wood lot haying. mowing w.
scythe turnng cocking.
Eve. Mtg.
Fri. 25 cloudy in a.m. cooler. cleared of
Harl's birthday 30 years old
a.m. finished hill lot cult. and hoe
then to wood lot. rake and cock.
p.m. finished cocking. Eli and Ike to party
at Garfords. Harl, Jno, Carrie, and 3 kids to
Lake on Electric cars.
Harl left
Eve. Lincoln Club. Quartette. Harl left for D.M.
Sat 26 cool.
a.m. Harl one load weedy hay from W side
wood lot. Jno. pitched off. Geo. stacked
p.m. one load from E side. Eli can
pitch about as much as I can.
Eli and I cultivated garden.
eve. walked over to see Art Winney but not at
home. Roy W F called.
Sun 27 fair cool.
Sene Corell to Ch. with our folk. Riedinger
preached. Quartette sang at Meth. S.S.
Marions special review exercise at our SS.
Big fire in p.m. Goldbergs grocery store.
Lake Ave SS at Smith's. School house not
ready. CE Consec. mtg. New topic cards out.
Completed

1897
Mon. June 28. fair. warmer.
cultivated at hill lot till 10:30. Jno. and
Eli and Ike hoeing. Then Jno and I went to
wood lot and pitched on a load on hay.
Geo. mowed clover N side E of ditch.
p.m. put load on stack, went up and
turned hay, got another load and stacked.
Eve. Walking with Roy talking over C.E.
Quartette practice. Ellis Wurts will take
Fred Reave's class at Lake Ave for a
month or so. Fred started for San Francisco
C.E. Conv. today noon. also Miss Sears and
Earnie Crisp.
Tues 29 good rain in a.m. clear off p.m. rain
again in night.
Cleared up the barn in p.m. Father and Eli
to hill lot planting beans etc. Then we
went to wood lot and turned hay.
Eve. C.E. business meetg.
Marion and Jno. drove down to Baker Dist.
to C.E. meeting.
Wed. 30 clouds. hot hot.
a.m. poling peas while kids picked peas and sold
2 1/2 pecks at 15 ct. a pk. Then to Woodlot to
turn hay. p.m. Eli Ike and I got a 1 horse load.
Geo. began mowing and broke down. We
rake and cocked the clover.
Eve. Choir social at Webster's. Quartette sang
Jo came home eve. train.
Completed

1897
Thurs. July 1st. hot. cloudy.
a.m. cultivating Jo, Eli and Ike and Keyes hoe.
p.m. kids hoe. Jno. and I mow with
scythe and wood lot.
Eve. prayer and teachers mtg. Invitation
from Meth. Ch. to use their Ch. during
rebuilding.
Fri. July 2. fair hot.
a.m. finished mowing with scythe and spread
and turned hay. opened out part of cocks.
p.m. Joe plant beans at hill lot.
rest of us to wood lot. Geo. mowed
the timothy so that all our grass is cut.
Raked that in orchard and put one load
on wagon and cocked up rest.
Eve. Lincoln Club. Election of officers.
Letter from Harl at Minneapolis: engagement
to Rena Goldsburg. surprise to all.
New potatoes for dinner.
Sat. 3 fair. hot fearfully.
a.m. mowed away 1 load hay in barn.
Stacked about 2 1/2 loads clover and another load on
wagon. Jo and Eli turning hay timothy.
p.m. John to Oberlin. stacked 2 more loads
clover (all there was). I pitched off.
Then cocked up timothy
Eve. hose bath. hottest night
could not sleep well
Sunday. 4th of July. 105 degrees in shade some say. A regular
Kansas hot wind. Corn curling up.
Last Sunday in Old Church.
Completed

July
Jail meeting conducted by Marion.
Ellis Wurts to Lake Ave with me.
S.S. at C. Miller's lawn. 13 present.
Quartette sang at our Ch. in eve.
Union C.E. mtg. our society. and the
Disciple in Disc. Ch. Roy Foley gave
report of State C.E. Conv. Dayton. good
Mon. 5 July. hot. until big thunder shower
late in afternoon.
finished big stack. and just began
a small one.
Eve. to Philpotts house to practise. C and H not there.
cool
Tues 6. little less hot.
a.m. we picked currants and cherries.
took 10 quts. blk currants to Curtis.
p.m. Jno. cultivated Eli and I hoed at
hill lot. Joe helped with Geo's hay.
we all turned in and helped cock a few min.
Wed 7. fair hot.
a.m. Geo. John and Jo. finished our hay.
Eli plant beans. I put Paris Green.
p.m. kids hoe. " " " "
we pitched on load of hay for Geo. at Eve.
Eve. Quartette at Philp. serenade Mary Taylor
Thurs. 8 fair. hotter.
a.m. I cultivate. Eli and Keyes hoe. hill lot
Jo. help at Uncle Eliabs hay. all day.
p.m. Jno Ike and I hoe till 3 then cock
hay for Geo till 5.45 Root family here
Eve. called on Lozier Dumas and Tedrow.
Completed

1897
Fri. July 9 
hot
a.m. cultivated and hoed till 10 then 
went to see circus parade.
p.m. Jno. Jo Eli Ike and I haying for Geo.
Jo teaches Ralph Fay 1 hr every eve.
Sat 10 fair hot
Jno. Jo Eli. Ike and I haying Geo.
all day and (except Jo) till 8:30 p.m.
haying by moonlight, 2 loads after supper
Jo went home to do chores.
Sun 11 very hot a.m. great rain at 10:30 and
drizzling all rest of day.
F
SS at 9 a.m. at Baptist Ch.
Lake Ave. 11 present. Bed 7:00
Mon 12 cool. drizzling rain after 3 p.m. great rain
in eve.
a.m. I put on Paris Green. Eli set out
cottage plants. Jo put on Paris Green for Geo.
p.m. 5 of us worked an hour for Geo.
mowing away in top of barn. Geo. began
cutting Wheat but rained.
eve. Quartette.
Tues 13 cool. very cloudy in a.m. gradually clear off.
a.m. home. I mowed grass in orchard.
kids picked currents etc. Ike mowed Benton's lawn.
p.m. cultivating & hoeing at hill lot. Geo.
cutting wheat. half done. We set up bundles
ad turned his cocks of hay.
First apple sauce new Artracans. see June 18
Wed 14 warmer. some cloudy.
All 5 of us work for Geo all day
Completed

1897
July
setting up wheat and cocking hay Eve. Quartette. Mr. Nevins at 43 telling about Homer Nash struggling w. drink appetite
Thurs 15 fair cool. cloudy in pm.
Jno- Jon Eli & I haying for Geo. all day 3 loads in horse barn. big barn about full. A and A and family here to supper on their way to Massachusetts.
Fri. 16 warmer. cloudy. drizzling rain p.m. 
a.m. having potatoes on flat. Jo went up to wood lot to see if hay stacks were all right. Johns hand very sore blister under callous. p.m. Jo, Eli, & I help Geo put  one load of hay in top of barn. 1 hour or so.
Em, Jo & Eli debated Annex of Canada Lincoln Club.
Sat 17 warm. threatening.
a.m. Home. picking blk currants 18 gal p.m. Jo Eli Jke & I haying for Geo. finished Dr. lanced Johns hand. Wilder in Wellington.
Sun 18  Father sick 8: a.m. see Apl. 18 side note Kingbirds & Wood Pewees flown from nest, see June 12.    warm threatening . clear off Eve. S.S. & came home with Franklin. Lake Ave. 22 present. Ellis Wurts
C E. Mayo lid.
Cadmus preached on the Transfiguration.
Rob Crehore Eloped last Thursday
Mon 19 a.m. Jo Eli + I help Geo hauling wheat. I stayed Geo's to dinner. big shower at noon. and another in afternoon. Wilder + Mary here. Ike has sick head ache & I doctored him.
Eve Roy Foley here.
Completed

1897
Tues. July 20. S.S. Picnic. Linwood. Net Jo Eli Keyes Nelson & I went. (Ike not well.) Read Ian Maclaren. Wilder left at noon. Good weather at Picnic but big rain at home in p.m. wheat soaked Ike met us at depot with wagon.
Wed. 21 Rain. rain. rain. cleared off late in p.m. a.m. Jo + I shelled about 9 bu corn and I took it to Mill.
P.M. S.S. lesson Till 3. Then moved grass in orchard Till supper.
Eve. all sat on verandah and talked. Mary. Jno. Carrie, Father Marion Net Jo Eli Ike + I.
Thurs 22. fair.
a.m. Jo. Eli + I helped Geo. open out wheat stack say 2 hrs work. hoed in garden at home.
p.m. cultivating + hoeing at hill lot. used muzzle on horse, corn higher than hand
Emily Wheeler + Mrs Wheeler, missionaries, at our house. Miss W. spoke at Eve. meetg. Harpoot. Euphrates College massacres. answers to prayer. faith healing.
Fri 23 fair.
hauling wheat for Geo till 5 p.m. finished stack. Jo Eli Ike + I
Eve. rode Jnas bicycle over to Geo. Crandall. Marion went to Oberlin + back with Wheelers
Sat 24 fair.
cultivating + hoeing at hill lot all day In p.m. Geo. cut our oats with binder and we set it up. Jno + Carrie to Oberlin on wheels
Completed

Sun. July 25 fair, hot.
S.S. 9 a.m. came home with Franklin + stayed with him during church. Lake Ave 27 present. Mrs Sears. Mrs Reynolds. Miss Rolling + Harry R. CE. Consec.    Sears, Bethel man, preached.
Mon 26 cloudy, sprinkle often, clear a while in p.m.
a.m. hoeing on flat Jo Eli + I (Ike Bentons lawn) p.m. hoeing corn at south end. jo. Eli. Ike. I horse shod new shoes all around.
Eve. Lee Day called
Tues. 27 rain (not much)
a.m. went to hill lot, hoed 1 row of corn a piece 4 rows, caught in rain, home, studied SS lesson read a little Greek + German.
p.m. mowed in orchard.
Eve. C.E. business meeting
Wed. 25 cloudy then fair.
Family picnic. Jo, Eli, Ike, Keyes, Nelson, Franklin, and I in wagon with Belle horse, John + Carrie on wheels. Father + Marion on Electric cars. Net stayed at home.
Thurs 29 fair
a.m. Jo, Eli, + I to hill lot hoeing: I planted turnips + beans p.m. Jo, Eli + I hoeing.
Eve. prayer mtg + teachers mtg
Fri 30 fair warmer
a.m. kids work in garden at home. I set up oats for Geo, blk berries. p.m. Eli + I + Keyes + Nelson to hill lot. Keyes + I plant turnips.
Father does not go to farm now days, can't ride see June 5.
Completed

Sat July 31. Hot. hoeing corn at hill lot all day. Jo Eli Ike + I. In p.m. John appeared with a hoe of Geo. Rich's and we finished at 4:30 Went in swimming in 40 in eve. then went all over town to get someone to go to Lake Ave.
Sun. August 1 cooler. fair.
S.S. and Church. Got Mr. Hults to take my place at Lake Ave and Arthur Winney to take Ellis Wurts' place. 28 present. Jail meeting talked on 40 Psalm.
C.E.       2 seats full of us went to Disciple Ch. + heard E W Allen preach on Paul at Athens.
Mon. Aug.2. hot
all of us work for Geo. John hauling oats. rest hoeing his corn. hauled our oats too. Geo + May called in eve. about picnic. Mrs Keener from Lake Ave. called about social
Tues.3. Hot. big family picnic. Geo Rich's family + Sutcliffs, Lizzie De Witt + our family Randalls Grove. Ice Cream etc. I came home on Electric cars with father to do chores. Band wagons home 8 p.m. Eli and Keyes stayed down at Aunt Sarah's.
Eve. called on Becker boys.
Wed 4 hot cloudy. tremendous storm after dinner. a.m. trimmed hedge at home. Jo + Ike work in garden.
p.m. wrote to Leon Flint. Ike went down to Lake on car to take some clothes to Eli+ Keyes.
Completed

Thurs. August 5 cool cloudy.
a.m. picked up apples. Ike + I went to Geo's and sharpened scythes, sickle 9 shears. cut grass some.
p.m. hauling rubbish from De Witt house sold to Wilson.
Eve. prayer mtg  called on Lozier.
Fri 6 fair. Jo Shovelling sand on Sugar Ridge.
a.m. Ike + I hill lot. mowed a few oats that were left by machine. trimmed hedge. Ice Cream for dinner. Johns treat.
p.m. hoe in garden a while. then hill lot alone trim hedge. Ike came up + picked beans.
A. and A + family arrived from Mass. to spend Sunday  Jno. Carrie + family went to Wellington
Sat 7 hill lot alone trim hedge all day finished hedge in front. Jo shovelling gravel. Geo. is hauling it to cemetary. Eli + Keyes home from Lake 
eve. Jo. Eli. and I to Hubert Days to eat Ice Cream
Sun. 8 cloudy.
Roy taught our SS classes. we had the little room back of pulpit. Cadmus invited us to sail. 
Jo. went to Lake Ave. with me 39 present
Everard was there.
C.E. I proposed going to Lake Ave. for Union meeting.   Disciple Ch. could not keep awake.
Mon 9 cloudy.
a.m. went down town + ordered 100 mimeograph letters for Co. SS. Assn. Broke John's bicycle.  p.m. Eli+ I hill lot. I trim hedge by river. Eli fork brush. Eve. 4 calls with horse on West side
Completed

Tues August 10. 1897 big storm last night. 
Ike and I work in garden all day. finish west half south land. Eli to Lake. SS. Class Jo shovel gravel.
Eve. swim in river.
Wed 11 fair. nice weather now days. warm days cool nights a.m. sending out Association Day Exercise to S.S. supt's of county. Jo gravel. p.m. Ike + I to Hill lot. Trim hedge finish
Thurs 12 fair. beaut.      Jo shovel gravel a.m. Marion + I started to go to lake Ave picnic Eli drove us down there at 7:30 + we found they had started at 7:00 so we came back. Went up + mended fence for Geo. p.m. Eli Ike + I to farm. I finished fence for Geo. Eli forked brush at hill lot. Then all went to wood lot. Trim hedge and cut poplars. Drove in through Jone's pasture
Eve. C.E. Exec. Com. 6:00.
prayer Mtg. hair cut teacher mtg.
Fri 13 fair. Eli Ike + I hoeing at hill lot all day Jo. shovel gravel. Took filter down to be repacked.   In p.m. Keyes + Neleon went to farm with us + picked up a load of corn stalks broken by storm.
Sat 14 warm. getting ready to rain. slight shower in eve. Eli + I load up Geo's manure wagon at Ensign's then hoe in garden till noon. Ike also. p.m. went to see Miss Sears about Local Union cut corn and grass for Sunday.
Eve. practise at Haines for C.E. quartette. 8p.m.
Completed

Sunday August 15th 1897 warm . threatening showers big shower at 4:30 p.m. rain bow. great thunder shower in Eve.
Roy taught S.S. classes. Knapp preached on vacation. Fred Reeve to Lake Ave. 39 present. Remley addressed C.E. quartette sang.
Mon. 16 cold windy cloudy.
a.m. went around to see S.S. kids and tell them about picnic. p.m. S.S. Class picnic. My class + Roy Foley class invited by Mr. Cadmus. Sail in sail boat in harbor. too stormy to go on lake. bathing, big surf. supper ball game. home 8.
Tues 17 cold night
a.m. carried chip dirt out of wood shed p.m. Eli Ike + I raking over garden. Jo still shovelling gravel every day. Jno. packing a box of house goods
Wed 18 fair cold.
a.m. raking in garden. Eli cleaned barn. p.m. mended bags shelled about 10 bu. corn + took to mill. Mowed thistles in pasture. Clare Davis here. Man from De Witt farm borrowed bags 31. Eve. Marion + I to revival meetg at West River Road.
Thurs 19 cold.
a.m. all kids to wood lot + hill elder-berrying. Asked Worden to let us know when heifer is bulling. p.m. Exec. Com. C.E. Union met Chaful 2:30 decided to hold Rally + picnic Randalls Grove.
Completed

Marion led prayer meeting. Dr. Sherwood led teachers'.
Friday August. 20. 1897 cold fair
Mursey's barns across river burned down last night 2 of them. a.m. went to see Miss Sears in C.E. business. Marion went to Lorain to look for a boarding place. Kids making a shanty in the grove. p.m. Hoeing at hill lot. and raking
Sat. 21. a.m. Program Com. for Rally met at Sears 8. Fred Reeve showed me shells pictures business of California. Roy called here.
p.m. mowed weeds by grave. Then Ike & Fowls & I went to hill lot & got load cornstalks Anne & baby came from Oberlin. Marion and Nelson went to Lorain to stay weeks. Annie will stay till Marion comes back.
Sun. 22 I taught Class in room back of pulpit.
Sat with Ike in Ch. Sermon on Feeding Five Thousand. Ike went to Lake Ave: S.S. w. me. 29 present. Young men's committee CE. 5:30
C.E. Society went en masse to Lake Ave in band wagon etc.
Mon 23 a.m. helped Geo. put on load of manure at Ensign's.  Mayo & Eli to hill lot 2 hrs.
p.m. Jo Eli Keyes & I picking up potatoes for Geo.
eve. went to revival meetg on H. River. took Miss Coniam and Miss Lickorich down
Tues. 24 S.S. class picnic Mr. Cadmus. Marion & child. went sailing with us, bathing 2, row boat ride. visit shipyards. home 5 p.m. with Henry Fowl.
Chas.

  Eve. C.E. business mtg. Charlie arrived home.

Wed. 25 Charlie, Eli, Keyes & I to wood lot. to  out muzzle on holstein heifer Beaut. Found her bulling.
Completed

Bute to Bull
and took her to Tattersall's fording river at water works. The other heifer jumped fence and followed.
p.m. wrote letters & notices C.E. Rally.
Thurs. 26 warm .. ... ..... .....
dug potatoes in garden. Kids painting 
3 p.m. Eli & I went to hill lot for corn fodder.
Eve. W.H. Tucker's office. prayer mtg.
Fri 27 monkeyed about Rally mostly. Picked some Tyson pears.  -- Eve. drove over to Sear's to get her to go to Cleveland to hunt a speaker.
Sat. 28  Drove to Field's corners started 5 a.m. to ask Prof. H.L. Willet of Chicago Univ. to speak at Rally. He was there at Disciple Convention. Unsuccessful.
Made some bill boards for Rally and put up 3 down town. Miss Sears secured of J.Z. Tyler.
Sun. 29 only 63 in our whole S.S. Roy taught class Hults went to Lake Ave. for me. Fred Reeve took him down with our horse. 14 present. Rainy. Jail Meeting Mr. Webster spoke. C.E. Consecration mtg. used 16 page selections from Excell's hymnbook. Took up collection for picnic.
Mon. 30 Roy and I went to see Mrs. Miller for use of Chapel for Wm. G. Warren Impersonater. Made 2 more bill boards for Rally and one for Warren.
p.m. mended bags. Hill lot for load of cornstalks, Clare Davis went with us.
Completed

also Annie & Carrie to Rich's.
Eve. Meeting of Citizens League Bapt Church, 7:00 Impersonator at Chapel 7:30 free. - collection.
Tues. 31. Aug. 97. Christian Endeavor Picnic & Rally. 
Randalls Grove.
a.m. painting. p.m. picnic. Nette Eli & I Marion & Nelson walked up beach from Lorain 2 big car loads from Elyria, 1:e over 100.
De. of Z. Tyler. splendid.
Marion sprained her ankle. Dr. Sherwood was there and took care of her.
Dr. Tyler gave me his Convention Program and news paper report of """"
Went home with Fern Smith.
Wed. September 1st. a.m. went to Geo.'s and  sharpened two axes. visited hill lot.
p.m. dig potatoes at hill lot. not worth digging. home on acct of rain and went in swimming. Eli bears us all (us kids) swimming.
Father Chas, Jno. Carrie & Franklin went to lake to see Marion.
Thurs. 2 a.m. mend bags Ike & I.
p.m. Jo, Eli, Ike & Keyes hill lot dig potatoes Chas & I wood lot cutting wood.
eve. prayer mtg. Camus back again.
Fri. 3 a.m. to Wood lot. Eli cut thistles. Keyes pile wood. Chas. & I cut wood.
p.m. Chas & I to wood lot. Eli & Keyes dig potatoes. Jo. painting. Kids to Lincoln
Club in eve.
Completed

Sat. Sept. 4 1897
a.m. sang at funeral of Mrs. Edwd Woodruff on W5 St.
p.m. Chas. Elli & I wood lot cut wood.
Jo. paintg. Father & Keyes to Lake & brot back Nelson.
Sun 5. Beautiful warm day
Roy taught class. Knapp preached.
Fred Reeve sick. Called on Frank Luther, S.T. Sears, and W. Phipps. 16 at Lake Ave. S.A.H. Williams at C.E.
Mon 6. Labor Day. very warm.
Red Cow Henrietta got astray in night, found at Geo.'s. Chas. Eli and I cutting wood all day. Jo painting house. Azariah and France here to dinner and they and Annie and baby and colored girl Mary went home in p.m. We kids went in swimming before supper.
Tues. 7 Nette's birthday 24. very warm.
First day of school. Jo. went to Oberlin
Cora Baker came to work for her board.
a.m. ran all over town after singers for Henry Hart's funeral. Mises Wetcher & Chapman and Mr. Philpott. p.m. went to funeral. eve. ran all over for singer for old Mr. Youngs' funeral.
Wed. 8 very warm
a.m. Chas & I picked Bartlett pears.
p.m. Geo. M Youngs funeral 92 yrs. old. than Chas. Nelson & I to wood lot picking pears, & crab apples.
Thurs 9 hot. 120 degree F in the sun.
night warm. a.n. played huckster
Completed

sold cauliflower tomatoes, cucumbers
bartlett pears and Fulton pears. $4.25
p.m. to Geo. Rich's Chas & I. got axe & saw
sharpened then I picked pears for Geo. and
Chas. helped him haul manure.
eve. prayer mtg. W.F. McMillan spoke
Fri Sept. 16 1897 Wilders birthday. hot.
Eli Ike & I in swimming before breakfast
Chas. to hill lot before breakfast for lot
of sweet corn. I took it down town but
could not sell it, Then Chas & I to 
wood lot sawing. p.m. Chas & I 
cleared out the 2 cisterns north of house
Net went to Lorain in p.m.
Sat. Sept. 11 1897 My birthday. 26 and nothing more.
hot. I was awfully cross all day,
sneaky mean. Barnum's Circus 
All we kids went over to Fair Ground and
saw the circus getting ready and they
went to Reublin's Mill and got on the 
awning to watch the parade, the
same as we used to do when Father owned
the mill. P.M. Chas. Eli & I cutting
wood at wood lot.
Marion came home from the Lake.
Sun. 12. still hot. but threatening rain. Eli gave me
2 birthday presents, a leather watch chain and 5
chewing gum. Last Sunday in the Bapt. Ch
I taught 3 classes kids. Eli & Fred Reeve to Lake
Ave. with me. they drove home & I staid at
C. Miller's to supper. Led the Lake Ave. C.E.
and walked home after it.
Completed

Mon. Sept 13 "97 hot, swimming before breakf.
a.m. Chas & I to woods, cutting
p.m. "  "  painting tin roof.
eve. called on Stark, Knapp, Reeder, Daniels, Jovell
Roy & Gates called here, getting up C.E. Quartette
Tues 14. hot, Ikes birthday.
a.m. took wagon to Crisp's for repairs.
Chas cut down Crab apple tree
we cut down the big beach tree in grove
full of initials.
p.m. sharpened axes. went to wood lot
& cut, wood.
Wed. 15 hot cloudy,
Father had sick spell just before breakfast
fell in the grape arbor. struck his head
and shoulder on stone. Chas attending him
most all day
[in margin] Father sick
see July 18
Picking Seckel Pears
Shelled corn in p.m.
Thurs. 16 took seckel pears to market 5 1/2 bu 1 1/2 bu  $2.30
picked the puckeries & sold them to huckster .35
p.m. Chas & I to woods a great weird storm
but very little rain. eve mtg.
Fri 17 cool.
a.m. sold 1 1/2 bus. tomatoes Brooks & Potter.
took corn to mill. dug potatoes in garden
p.m. Chas & I begun cutting corn.
Jo came home Eve. picked over beans for Sunday dinner.
Sat 18 a.m. Theshing at Geo. 25 bus. oats,
Geo. had 151 bus. wheat. Annie & her kids here
p.m. Chas. Jo. & I cutting corn
Completed

Sunday Sept. 19. 1897 cool.
First Sunday in Opera house.
SS. Rally day all my class but 2 rest.
Lake. Ave. 23 pres, Halts taught class.

"  "  C.E. attended our C.E.

Right has calf. Eve. sacred concert Opera House.
Chas. walked to wood lot before breakfast
and found Right (the heifer) had her
calf. brot her down to Geo. Rich's.
Mon. 20 cool.

Chas. Jo & I cutting corn a.m. & p.m.

finished cutting.
Brought Right home at noon. left calf at Georges.
Picked 2 1/2 bus. grapes at hill lot.
Tues 21 cold Nelsons birthday 7. 1st Fair day.
a.m. took bus. tomatoes Mrs. Perry .25
First frost
Chas. Jo & I picked up corn scattered around 
at hill lot. Then worked cutting of the 
big beech tree in grove.
Chas. left
p.m. cutting wood in grove till 3:30
Then Chas. & all of us to wood lot
after hickory nuts. corn, tomatoes, pumpkin vines beans etc. snipped by frost
Chas. left on midnight train.
Wed 22 cool.
a.m. monkeyed split wood in grove.
Jo to College
p.m. rode to Oberlin with J. Then all
of us picked beans. hill lot.
eve. mended pants.
Thurs. 22 a.m. Eli & I cuts shock of the sweet corn on
flat. then dig potatoes. Mrs Richardson to dinner
p.m. dig potatoes. kids pick up. Keyes & Nelson
Completed

to fair in p.m.
Fri. Sept. 24. 1897  fair
a.m. pick over potatoes. Then to hill lot
Eli & I dig potatoes. Ike Keyes & Nelson pick beans.
p.m. Eli & I put up the blinds that had been
painted by Jo & Eli. Then saw wood in
grove. At 4 oclock we all went over 
to the fair.
Eve. Lincoln Club
Sat. 25 in a.m. began cutting wood in grove when
Geo. sent for us to come up & help
him hauling seed-clover. Eli & I helped
him rest of day & Stocked 3 loads & left
1 small load on wagon. paid me  75
Eli & I went in swimming in eve, water cold.
Roy & Birt Darling called in eve.
Sun 26. S.S. Assoc. Day. warmer.
Male Quartette at Church.
S.S.  Mrs. Griswold led Jail meetg.
Union Mtg of Lake Ave. and River
Road S.S. at latter. Assoc. Day exercises.
Address by Marion.
Cadmus led C.E. Consec. mtg.
Fine Sermon in eve.
Mon 27 fair.
a.m. helped Geo, finish out clover stack
sharpened feed cutter.
p.m. Reisinger came to see cow
Did some Co. S.S. Assoc. business
after school we went hickory nutting to
wood lot. Eli Ike Keyes & I late to supper.
Completed

Tues. Sept, 28 "1897 fair. hard frost.
a.m. Mr. Standen here wanting to buy pears.
picked the Duchess pears. 2 bus. Went
down & got visitation cards from Cadmus.
p.m. picked the pears in S.W. corner of yard
Standen bought 1 bus.                             60
Eve. to W. River Road C.E. to take card for
house to house canvas. & cold.
Wed. 29 fair. warm days cold nights
a.m. finished picking the pears in S.W. corner.
p.m. took Mothers tricycle to repair shop.
got load of pumpkins & squashes from hill lot.
after school took up kids & picked beans.
eve. Chapel practising for Life of Luther show.
Thurs 20 fair hot. night little less cold
a.m. began digging Rural N.Y. Potatoes
p.m. same. kids came up after school
with lumber wagon. nearly finished
eve. practise for entertainment.
Fri October 1st  some cloudy
very dry. dust dust. had no rain to speak of
for a month. scarce of water for house.
a.m. fixed a bin in cellar and put
in the Rural N. Y. potatoes.
p.m. picked tomatoes in garden; took 
down 2 bus. pears and 1 1/2 bus. of
tomatoes. sold to Potter. $1.40
eve. practise for entertainment.
Sat. 2nd a.m. all picking up potatoes for George
p.m. kinds same as in a.m. Eli to Opera House.
working on flower com I went to a funeral (Crabtree)
Completed

then picked winter pears by corn house
eve. practise Luther Entertainment.
Sunday October 3. fair. Black cow has calf
S.S. Started for Lake Ave. with horse but
broke down, came back & borrowed Fay's bicycle.
[in margin] Black cow 
After S.S. arranged for house to house canvas.
Mixed Quartet misses Haines & Lord. Messrs Rich & Metcalf
sang at C.E. After C.E. the new Male Quartette
Dunham Metcalf Gardner Foley practiced.
Mon. 4  fair
a.m. mended harness. went to wood lot to see
if any water there, found plenty. then to hill lot
dug the rest if the Rural N.Y. Potatoes
p.m. picked tomatoes and winter peas.
eve. practise Luther entertainment great.
Father has begun to use Catheter.
eve. practise Luther entertainment.
Tues. 5 a.m. mended wheel barrow and ladder
tied up ears of sweet corn in bundles
p.m. cows got through fence into Smiths garden
Father tried to drive them in & used himself
up awfully. heart trouble. I mended fence.
Eli and I picked Keiffer pears.
eve. practise entertainment
Wed. Cleaned out cistern south of house
Went to Lorain helped Geo. move Mr. Cadmus'
goods. 4 1/2 hours on the road.
eve. Reisinger came for calf   $1.00
practise entertainment.
Thurs. a.m. finished delivering Cadmus furniture.
p.m. Sang at funeral of Old Mrs. Stocking  2 solos
split wood in grove, Eve. 1st performance of Luther Entertainment.
Completed

Friday October 8, 1897 cloudy.
a.m. cleaned out corn house, shelled.
p.m. took 3 bus. corn & 3 bus. oats to mill
ground together. paid for grinding . 30
took 2 bus. pears and 1/2 bus. tomatoes $1.30
went to wood lot and hauled load of wood.
eve. last performance Luther entertainment.
night warm.
Sat. 9. a.m. Eli & I sawed wood in grove
kids pick up apples. Eli & Marion to
Oberlin on noon train.
p.m. to hill lot w. Ike Keyes & Nelson pick beans
Marion, Eli, Jo & Dale McFarland of Des Moines
walk from Oberlin. Ike & Keyes walk
out to meet them.
Sunday 10. Not to Ch. S.S.
Lake Ave. w. tree Reeve. House to house canvas
arranged for. Down to L.A. again in eve.
with crowd. to C.E. Missing mtg led by Fern Smith.
Mon 11. warm. Beside Rich here at 5:30 a.m. 
to tell us wood lot on fire. Jo. Ike & I
went up. All the neighbors were in
[in margin] Woodplot on fire
there fighting fire & had it under control.
Geo. hauled 2 tanks of water from 
river. Jo. home & went to Oberlin at noon.
Everything was so dry the fire burned
down into the ground. Many trees
burned down. About 5 p.m. it rained
[in margin] rain
hard and later in night rained again
Ralph Kuchenrither is said to have set fire Sunday
Completed

Tues. Oct. 12 1897 mud actually.
a.m. helped Geo. return the tack to 
Mayfield's. Went to wood lot. fire
most all out. picked up a few hickory nuts.
sharpened hay knife.
p.m. took 4 1/2 bushel pears and
one bus. tomatoes to town. $2.90
Then helped Geo. dig potatoes back of
barn.
Wed 13. a.m. picked winter pears.
p.m. to wood lot. split up big chunks
of beech in east end, sawed last winter. 
hauled a load stove wood.
Thurs. 14 a.m. down Lake Ave. house to house.
p.m. picked winter pears. then to town
took down iron pump for repair. got
3 axe handles 75 ct. box of Quartette books at
freight depot. 33 cts. Then to hill lot for
cabbages for cows.
eve. Annual mtg. of Church. election.
Quartette at Philpotts office. Prosser.
Fri. 15 last night warm. today hot
a.m. to wood lot split some. hauled load 
stove wood. broke down just as driving
into yard.
p.m. for load to wood shed & unloaded.
burned out a couple of broken axe handles.
Eve. C.E. Quartette at Philpotts store.
Sat. 16. Eli & I to wood lot sawing.
in p.m. there was a fire alarm & we came
home fearing our barn was on fire.
Completed

then Ike & I sawed in grove.
Sunday Oct. 17 1897.
[in margin] Father in bed all day
Jno Tite & Will Lozier at S.S.
Roy, Miss Sears & S.A.H. Wms. to Lake Ave.
Roy led C.E.
Mon. 18 a.m. sold tomatoes .25
got medicine for cow Petunia (Dr. Moysey) .50
brot. home lumber wagon from Earlys
set tires & new cross bar 1.50
[in margin] Father rode down town with Uncle E.W.
p.m. load stove wood from woods
Eve. Quartette at Philpotts. Prosser.
Tues. 19 a.m. hauled load stove wood.

             p.m. "         "      furnace ".

over to West side with Marion for washer
