woman. Sold dozen egg plant   25
Pump mended.        65
eve. Roy called.
Wed 20 a.m. sprinkling some. husked corn. 10 bus.
p.m. sold Keiffer pears 1 3/4 bus. $1.00
split wood.
eve. Exec. Com. County S.S. Assos.
Quartette.
Thurs. 21 a.m. husking corn 7 bus.
p.m. canvassing on west side for
Mr. McMillan for new Cong. Ch. on W wide
eve. prayer mtg. & teachers mtg.
Fri. 22. a.m. husking corn 10 bus.
p.m. canvassing on West side as yesterday
eve. Lincoln club Cadmus talked.
Mr. Root here. Florence Bullock in 
town.
Completed

Sat. Oct. 23, 1897
a.m. shelled corn. new corn. Eli took
it to mill. split wood.
p.m. all of us picking apples at home.
Father is failing much. Has "Angina Pectoros".
terrible pain at heart. Also has to
have catheter used. I have used it for him
every 2 hours or so today. In bed all day, except
a few minutes in morning. Needs pretty
constant attendance. They will probably send
for Chas. to come home & take care of him.
Sun. 24. Attended only S.S. and Jail service.
Quartette sand "Some sweet day" at Jail.
Doctor gave Father hypodermic injection of morphine
last night & he has been quieter & less
painful, slept heavily in night and today.
Mon. 25 bed last night from 6:30 - 1-- then
sat up rest of night with father. medicine
every hour. Father better.
a.m. to Garfords after koumiss for father.
to West side with washing.
p.m. pick apples at home.
Harl. arrived 6:50 I slept up stairs.
Tues. 26 a.m. hill lot picking apples.
p.m. Harl to Cleveland to see Pilgrim Ch.
people
Wed 27 sat up latter part of last night w. father.
a.m. hill lot. apples. Chufer, kohl rabi.
p.m. pick over chufers Eli pick quinces after
school. bed 7 p.m. up stairs
Completed

Thurs. Oct. 28 1897.
a.m. Wood lot pick apples Northern Spy.
p.m. cows broke per pasture fence.
mended fence. then again to wood
lot for apples.
Fri. 29 a.m. Wood lot pick apples.
p.m. Net used horse. drove to 
Oberlin with Florence Bullock
I cut down part of hay stack & put
it in barn.
Sat 30 a.m. Eli Ike & I finished picking 
apples at Wood lot. picked up all
apples from ground as we went along. 
p.m. Eli and I to wood lot sawing.
eve. Roy Foley here. slept down stairs.
[in margin] Jo's birthday 17 yrs.
Sun. 31 only 4 boys at SS.
Lake Ave. 24 present . Gates there & rode back
with me. Jo. at home. bed 7. up stairs
Monday Nov. 1st 1897 first rain sine Oct 11 It had become very dry again,
drizzling rain all day
[in margin] rain
a.m. took washing to west side. with Keyes
stayed wit Father while Harl. slept.
p.m. Keyes and I shelled corn Keyes
did not have to go to school. Eli & I
picked over chufers. Jo did not go back to Ob.
his face all swollen with toothe ache. Azzie
here to supper. Bed 7. till11:30. then
sat up with Father. rain all night.
Tues. 2. rain rain rain 
fixed pump into cistern south of house
made saw buck. Drove to west side
Completed

after washing. Saw Moysey & got some
more medicine for Petunia cow. Voted
for D C Baldwin.
Wed. Nov. 3 fair & beautiful
a.m. husked corn
p.m. Harl went to Cleveland again so
I had to stay at home. Azzie here
on eve. train & sat up all night with
Father. Harl started 10 p.m. for
Evansville Ind. YMCA.Conv. be gone
over Sunday. Jo still at home: toothe-ache
Thurs. 4 fair. repaired floor in cow stable
also cow mangers. Eli & I hauled
up 3 loads wood from grove. I have
to go in and use Catheter for
Father about once in two hours.
Sat up all night with Father. 
Found a horse blanket and a lot of good carpenters tools secreted
in the hay in north shed.
Fri. 5 Annie and her baby here a.m.
Made a box trap.
Azzie here on eve. train and sat up
all night w. Father
Sat 6 Eli took corn to mill a.m.
Eli Ike Keyes & Nelson to hill lot
husking corn. I crawled into the
furnace and fixed floor and then
built a fire. Marion telegraphed Harl Jno Chas
p.m. Eli & Ike peddled bills for McMillan
West side meeting tomorrow.
fixed Gladioli. Geo Rich sat up with
Father. Annie here p.m. stayed all night
[in margin] Father failing
Completed

Sun Nov 7 1897 Father little stronger.
Marion taught my SS class,
Roy Supt'ed Lake Ave.
Harl arrived 2 p.m.
Chas ""       6 p.m.
I sat up w Father all night
C.E.s went to West Ridge.
Mon. 8 John arrived 5:30 a.m.
train, took washing over.
slept in p.m. then dug last
potatoes in garden 1/2 bus. Harl sat up
Tues. 9 rain
sold 3 bus.  Winter Pears,
Root here to supper, Chas sat up
Wed 10 rain Chas. putting in window lights.
house cellar barn. 
p.m. I led Petunia to bone meal works
picked over rest of winter pears.
John sat up.
Thurs 11 rain some a.m. took 2 bus. Winter Net's Pears
to town sold 60 cts a bus. Chas and I
to Geo's sharpening tools then to Hill
lot brot down a little load of beets.
p.m. put beets in cellar. Went to
west side for washing. got in the red
beets from garden. also few tomatoes.
I sat up. snowed some in night
Fri. 12 snow a little. not snow much on ground
a.m. monkeyed rat poison & mending
rubber boots. ground frozen a little
Completed

p.m. Chas. John and I got two
loads beets from hill lot and
put in cellar. cold fingers.
Harl sat up.
Sat. Nov. 13. cold. ground frozen. cleared off
in p.m. a.m. Eli Ike & I hill lot
husked corn 17 bus.
p.m. we emptied corn. went to hill lot
& got a load of carrots. put in cellar
and dug the tuberoses. Jno & Harl
to Oberlin..Annie here to supper.
Jo came home.
Sun. 14 rain rain rain
Only one boy (Murbach) in S S Class
Roy & I rode to Lake Ave. Only 2 there
C.E. mtg. in Opera House. Quartette at
Foley's. Jno sat up.
Mon 15 a.m. shelled corn warm
p.m. Chas. & I to hill lot got
the rest of the carrots and the onions
John left 10 a.m. for Alabama
I sat up.
Tues. 16 colder. took corn to mill
got groceries from Brooks.
Eve. Quartette at Dunhams.
Wed 17. a.m. dug onions beets carrots in
garden. p.m. cut up limb of English-
streak Apple tree.
Harl let for Des Moines. I sat up.
Thurs. 18 p.m. trim trees at hill lot.
Florence Bullock to supper. cold night
Completed

Friday Nov. 19 1897 warming up.
a.m. husked corn 2 shocks 8 bus.
p.m. Eli (home from school early) and I
husked 3 shocks 12 bus. old Mr. Jerome
over there. broke wagon a little. I sat up.
Sat 20 Fair warm
Eli Ike & I husk corn a.m. 5 shocks
17 bus. p.m. 6 shocks 19 bus.
Father seems better
Sun. 21 Fair. warm.
lots of boys at SS. Tite, Vincent, Yesberger.
Roy Miss Sears & I to Lake Ave. 22 present
mostly children. appointed Committee for
Christmas. Quartette before C.E.
I sat up.
Mon 22 cloudy cooler
a.m. hauled 4 loads furnace wood
from grove to cellar
p.m. slept. then brot. in bedding
from stack.
Tues. 23 coldest yet?
a.m. mowed away corn stalks
p.m. took nap. then Eli Ike & I
to hill lot got load stalks.
Annie here supper lost my mittens
Wed 24 very cold
a.m. mowed away corn stalk
p.m. monkeyed. chop corn stalks
Chas. hauled rest of wood fr. grove
bought mittens. Will Young here.
Jo came home.
Completed

Thursday Nov. 25 1897 Thanksgiving
Eli Ike Keyes Nelson to Oberlin on
cars. Marion Net Jo & I to
Geo. Rich's Chas & Father alone.
a.m. took gifts from SS class
to poor family on Woodland Ave
G?olly by name.
got Spring wagon full turnips
from hill lot.
Jo. back to O. in eve.
warmer. rainy.
Fri. 26 warm. rain a.m.
a.m. slept kids shelled beans
p.m.          "       "          "  finished.
I got 2 loads turnips.
Sat  27 warm.
a.m. we finished turnips
p.m. husked corn Eli Ike & I 4 shock 14 bus.
Sun. 28 new boy in S.S. Jim Brown
Lake Ave. 21 present. Temperance lesson.
Everhard taught, Quartette sang 2 songs.
Went to C.E. & Eve. service.
Mon 29 growing cold.
a.m. hauled load corn stalks.
p.m. husked 1 shck 3 1/2 bus. & hauled
load stalks, cold.
Tues 30 Coldest yet. frozen solid. roads awful
a.m. shelled corn
p.m. to mill. had horses' front shoes
re-set. Eli had her shod behind a few
days ago. got some sweet corn from hill lot.
Completed

Wed. Dec. 1st 1897
husking corn. in a.m. Geo. went by
and said I ought to bring heifer home from
woods.
Thurs 2 a.m. moved away stalks. After recess
Eli & I went to wood lot and brought
Bute home. Examinations at school
Eli did not have to go.
p.m. husk corn. Eli came up &
helped after recess.
Fri. 3 a.m. mowed away stalks, then to
hill lot, husking, very late to dinner.
p.m. husking. warmer.
Sat 4 warm, raining.
a.m. Eli Ike & I to hill lot in mud
brot home 3 shocks unhusked.
p.m. Sang at Funeral of old Mr. Jno.
Roig down Lake Ave. Kids husked
all the corn we brot down a.m.
Sun 5 cold. frozen solid. Roads awful
S.S. & Lake Ave. Stella Foley went
down to "  "
Benton led C.E.   Eve. Ch. service.
Mon 6 a.m. odd jobs at home

          p.m. husk corn. sat up.

Tues 7 husked corn a.m. & p.m.
Rae Gaylord here at noon
Wed 8 husk corn a.m. & p.m.
we met A.H. Cross at 5: oclock train
went to Chapel to supper with him
then we went to Lorain to a
Completed

Township S.S. mtg. Organized a Tsp.
S.S. Assoc. Lorain & Sheffield tps. 
Pres. E.E. Hopkins. Secy Miss Alexander.
Thurs. 9 husk corn p.m. In a.m. hauled
load of wood. Roads bad.
Fri. 10 a.m. husk corn.

          p.m. Chas. went up & we finished

husking the last 4 shocks.
Then after school, kids & I went up
again & got the stalks.
husking all done.
Sat. 11 rain in night.
a.m. I cut some off from stack.
Eli chopped corn stalks. Then Eli Ike &
I shelled beans etc.
p.m. Eli Ike and I went to woods
and sawed.
Eve. Quartette at Miss Sears'. Xmas music
Sun. 12. S.S. review.   Jo at home.
Lake Ave. with Roy & Miss Sears. reelected supt.
Roy. Assistant.  Emmert led C.E.
After C.E. Quartette practise Xmas music
at Chapel.
Mon. 3 a.m. to wood lot shopping
p.m. to hill lot. got last shock of
sweet corn. and pile up brush
some Then down to Dr. Sherwood's
He wants me to get singers for
Ada's funeral.
Tues. 14. a.m. down town for singers
p.m. funeral. Vessel  .25
Completed

Wed. Dec. 15 1897.
a.m. cut part of stack and put
in barn.
p.m. to woods chopping.
Oberlin Electric R R running. Sat up.
Thurs. 16. a.m. to Geo.'s sharpen axes etc.
the to hill lot trimmed 1 apple tree.
p.m. to woods chopping.
eve. called at Jail to see about mtg.
next Sunday. Prayer mtg. led by
C.E.'s ; Miss Sears. leader.
Fri. 17. snowing. & raining colder om p.m.
a.m. shelled corn.
p.m. monkeyed
Eve. Henry Hall called.
Sat 18 Eli Ike and I went to woods 
cutting. a.m. and p.m. quite cold
Sun. 19 cold. 10 boys at S.S.
Eli drove down to Lake Ave. with Miss
Sears. He taught the boys' class.
Jail meeting, good one. 9 went.
Eve. Jennie Gould led C.E. Special Service
for Forefathers Day. Leonard read paper.
I sat up.
Mon. 20  very slippery. icy.
a.m. took corn to mill and did various
errands around town. p.m. paid for
$11.00 a ton of bran at Elyria Milling C.
Brot home 735 lbs.
Eve. walked down to Lake Ave
to the practice for Xmas.
Completed

Tues. Dec. 21 1897
to woods lot a.m. and p.m.
In p.m. drove around by East Ave
and through Jones' pasture. Stopped at
Benningtons to see Miss Hulbert.
Eve. Mrs. & Dr. Hart's. Repub. office
Philpotts & Daniels pair rubbers $.75
Quartette.
Wed. 22 1 inch of snow
a.m. fixed up the old shed.
p.m. went to woods lot on sled.
sat up.
Thurs 23 a.m. to wood lot with sled.
p.m. battening cracks in barn.
coldest day yet
Fri. 24. a.m. trimming apple trees at home.

           "  " cutting up limbs. bummed in

house an hour.
Eve. Christmas entertainment at Lake
Ave. Eli & I & Benton & Roy went
down. They presented me with a 
pair of mittens, an umbrella, and a 
book "..Kept for the Masters Use."
Sat 25 Christmas  Jo here.
Cut down part of stack.
Kids skating. Dinner of
Christmas Goose a present from
Cora Baker's father. sat up.
Sun. 26 S.S.  Ike and Fred Warner
ock to Lake Ave, 13 present.
C.E.. SS. Xmas entertainment.
Completed

Monday Dec, 27. 1897
a.m. found that # cross cut saw was stolen.
borrowed another from. Geo. & Eli Ike & I
went to woods. cut down big maple
tree near ditch. p.m. to woods. Ike
walked up.  Eve. played Pillow Dex.
Tues 28 We three to woods a.m. & p.m.
took big wagon and brought
home small loads.
Wed 29 a.m. to woods. stormy. wet snow.
brought home green furnace wood.
p.m. home. chop stalks. pile wood in
cellar.
Thurs 30 did not freeze last night.
a.m. Eli & I to woods. not Ike. finished the big
maple & some others.
p.m. to woods with Ike. cut 2 beech & 2
ash trees in a heap.
Eve. prayer mtg. Prof. Anderson up Wyoming
Collegiate Inst.
C.E. business mtg. I presided.
Fri. 31 Dec. 1897 colder, N wind, snow.
a.m. to woods. Ike walked to Adams corner.
load of stove wood. Cut big rotten Elm.
p.m. to woods with sled.
Eve. Eli & I to Bible Lecture by Bosworth.
and sundry errands down town.
Father some pain. Chas. & I both down
stairs at night. Jo, home 11 p.m. on
Electric cars. Father had 'heart pains caused
by sour stomach.
Completed

Saturday January 1st 1898
New Years Day.  cold.
Father was easier latter part of night
I laid down from 5 to near 7 a.m.
Chopped 5 bundles corn stalks.
A, and A, France & Baby Marion come on
9 oclock car.
Then the great show. When they were all
ready to begin I brought in from dining
room a big bran bag containing Nelson
and labeled "A Good Boy. To Marion
from Nelson." This was Nelson's own scheme.
Father was wheeled in his great
leather chair to door of his room, so
he could look on.
My Presents 2 flannel night gowns from Marion
bag of candy & presents                  "  "
Little S.S. Lesson Book                   " "
Picture of France & Baby Marion     " Annie
Cuff holders                                    " "
Napkin holder                                  " "
Pair Sleeve holders                         " France
Relic of Old Church                        " Jo
Pair Ice Creepers                            " Eli
Sat shirt studs 3                              " Ike
Bottle Almond Cream  (Eli & I)         " "
2 fine pencils                                   " "
Bath mitten                                      " Marion
Pair leather shoe strings                   " Nelson
We all gave Father a house coat. and he wore
it when he sat up second time while
Completed

1898 Jan.
we were at dinner (scalloped oysters. and
mince & apple pie with whipped cream. pie
brot over by A & A. nuts & candy furnished
by Jo.)
Quartette at Foley's before dinner.
Hubert Day to see Father.
A & A. etc. back to O on 3 p.m. car.
I called on Beckers and Tite.
Gates Gardner to supper.
Sat up with Father 1st part of night.
Baby Marion is a picnic.
Father had to use Catheter every hour
Sunday Jan. 2. 1898 Cold. very.
12 boys at S.S.
Roy, Miss Sears, & I to Lake Ave. I wore
2 overcoats, overshoes, big cap. 20 present.
Dr. here. washed out Father's bladder.
C.E. Consecration Meeting.
Quartette sang at 2nd Cong. Church
"Pastor's Welcome." Up with
Father till 12. Then bed till 8.
Mon. 3 Warmer. Jo. back to O.
Staid with Father while Chas. slept.
Cleaned out Right's stall.
Net Eli & Marion to Prayer mtg
I sat up with Father first part of night
Tues. 4 a.m. warmer. Took Right to bull. 
Stayed w. father 9-12 a.m. Chas slept
p.m. Chas. went hauling manure
from Day's barn with Geo. I
stayed with Father.
[In margin] Right N.B.
Completed

Wed. Jan. 5 '98 warm beautiful.
a.m. Chas. slept. I with Father
p.m. I went to woods brought 
load furnace wood,
Eli sore throat. bed.
Sat up all night. worst night he had.
Thurs. 6. Got up & did chores. went to bed and
slept till time for chores in p.m.
Eli in bed all day.
Eve, with father till 12.30
Ike sick in night threatened sore throat.
Fri. 7 Doctor pronounced Eli cured.
Ike slept till after dinner.
I was with Father in a.m. In p.m. sang
at Mrs. Cobb's funeral.
Eve. with Father till 10.
Sat 8 With Father all day. Chas. rest.
Eli & Nelson to Oberlin on Electric.
take clothes for Jo.
Sun. 9 Ralph's birthday   warm.
With Father a.m. Marion taught my S.S.
class 13 boys there.
p.m. to Lake Ave. with Roy and Miss Sears
14 present. good roads. Keyes a little sick
Slept 7-11 p.m. Up rest of night.
Mon. 10 warm, muddy.
Bed all day, 9:30 - 5
Up all night.
Tues. 11 warm. a.m. shelled 2 bags corn & took to Shay's
mill at Coonville, Geo. Rich gave me 1/2 for Mrs. Cobb funeral
Bed 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Azzie here in Eve.
Completed

Wed. Jan. 12 1898 very warm. 
thunder & lightning. heavy rains.
a.m. filled 6 bags with corn ears.
Bed 9:30 a.m - 5 p.m.
Ridgeville election yesterday. went dry
by increased majority. over 100.
[in margin] up all night
Thurs. 13. warm
a.m. took corn to Coonville mill.
Bed 10 a.m. - 7:30 p.m. Up all night
Fri 14. Bed 9:30 - 6 rain rain.
Father had a very bad time in Eve. Chas.
lay on bed down stairs all night, but
very comfortable night comparatively
Sat 15  rain rain.
Bed 8 - 5 Roy Foley here 7:30 a.m.
Father walked out into dining room.
Sunday Jan. 16. colder. little snow.
Bed 8 - 11 a.m. S.S. taught my class.
Hiched up horse for Roy Foley to go to Lake Ave.
Bed 2 - 7 p.m. Up all night. read
Ten nights in a Bar room"
Mon. 17 colder. a.m. trimmed apple trees a little 
in garden. Bed 9:30 a.m. - 7 p.m.
Mrs. May Goldsbury Channon here. Father had
his pants and coat on and went out into
sitting room to see her.
Tues 18 a.m. colder. frozen roads. Went to mill
for corn meal. see Thurs. 13.
Bed 10 to 5
Completed

Wed. Jan. 19. warmer
Bed 8:30 --5. Nelson or hit
by a stone, over his left eye
Made a cut had to be sewed up.
Eve. rain. rain all night.
A. and A. here in eve.
Father ate dinner with the
family at table
Thurs 20 Bed.
Fr. 21. In eve, went to Prof. Bosworths Bible
Lecture with Marion.
Eli does all the chores nowadays
with some help from Ike
Father has much pain & frefulness.
great appetite. goes out to the
table at dinner time.
Sat. 22. a.m. Eli & I cut down 3 trees
in grove. dead Cucumber & hemlock and
old Pepprige stub. Bed 11 a.m. - 7 p.m.
Ike  to Oberlin on Electric,
Rain all p.m. Windy in night.
3 hemlock trees blown down.
Sun. 23. Bed 9 a.m. - 11 S.S. boy Larry Rice
Bed p.m. till 8.
Mond. 23 Bed. 9-5. Eve. walked down to Lake Ave.
Having special mtgs there. Wannamaker
Cadmus & Stocking. W. preached tonight,
Geo. Rich haul load furnace wood.
Tues. 25 rain all day.
a.m. cut some from stack. Bed 9- 5:30
Annie here in P.M. Jo. in Eve.
Completed

Wed Jan. 26. 1898 colder
chopped some stalks.
Eve. called on Old Mrs. Mallory but did not
see her. Dropped into special meeting at
Disc. Church. Bartlett preached on
"unpardonable sin"
Thur. 27. cut bedding from stock. colder.
Eve. to meetg. at Lake ave. walked.
Back with Wannamaker.
Fri. 28. chopped some corn stalks.
Eve. Ely Ike & I to Roy Foley's to candy pull for
Roy's and my S.S. classes. All but 3 of my
boys there.
Sat 29 Fathers Birthday 1822- 1898 76.
He came out into sitting room to prayers.
I cleaned out Rights stall and chopped wood 
in grove a little while. A. & A and France in p.m. Jo in eve.
Eve. Mr. & Mrs. L.L. Sears 40# Wedding Anniv.
Sun. 30 bed 8-11 a.m. S.S. first Sunday in the
intermediate: Reese Young Fletcher & Murbach had
all answers written. Talked about organizing class.
The Lake Ave. with Roy & Miss Sears 22 present
Jo to "  "  "  "  "  "  in eve.
Bed 5 - 8:30
Mon 31 colder windy.
Eve. Local Union Exec. Com. Mtg. nobody came
Tues. February 1st colder 4 degrees F.
Eve. Harold came on 6:50 Train
Eli and I met him and I went
down afterwards with hand-sled for
his trunk.
Completed

Wed. Feby 2. cold Ground hog day
a.m. shelled crn.
Thurs 2. cold 7 degrees below 0 last bight
hydrant frozen up and broken. get water from
cistern instead. opening oysters.
Harold Marion & Nette to Oberlin in p.m.
Fr 4 warmer S wind
a.m. cut some from stack. Eli &
Ike hauled it to barn w. spring wagon.
Eli took corn to Reublin's mill.
Kids did not have to go to school except
Keyes & Nelson
Sat 5 a.m. we sawed wood in wood shed.
Sun 6 Beautiful clear day. Thawing,
S.S.
Lake Ave. 20 present
Father failing.
Mon 7 a.m. down town to get Foley to
fix hydrant. Harold to Cleveland
Ev. Exec. Cum. Local C.E. Union. Elwin Oakes
of Ridgeville appointed Chairman. Jo here over night
Tues 8 a.m. To school see Miss Sears & Fern Smith
very warm raining some. Harold back.
Mr. & Mrs. Hubert Day here in Eve.
Wed. 9 a.m. took notices to papers. C.E. union
bought diary for Chas.
eve. Harold Nette & Marion to Chapel Supper.
I o Local Union Com. Mtg. 8:30
A and A here in eve.
Completed

Thurs. Feb. 10" 1898. warm. muddy
chopped some stalks. split some wood.
hitched up horse and went down to Ingersoll
Law Office and got him to go up to
John Ryan's to take acknowledgement of
quit claim died, he said ought to be
surveyed.
Fri. 11 warm rainy.
got up 3:30 p.m. took Electric car
for Oberlin . got there for Capel a
little late. Annie's to supper. With 
Jo to Oratorical contest. Long fraternity symbols circle with line through it and triangle first
Frank Wilford fraternity symbols circle with line through it and K seconds home 10.
Sat 12 Jo home in eve.
Saun. 13. S.S. then right down to Lake Ave. in
cab to Mr. Norton's funeral. No S.S. at L.A.
Harold & Eli went to 2nd Cong. Ch. in eve.
Mon. 14 a.m. took Ingersoll up to Ryan's and
got quit claim signed & acknowledge
and gave R. fathers receipt in full
Stopped at Rich's and asked him to bring
us a load of wood.
little colder. bed 1:30 p.m.
Tues. 15 growing colder. storm & wind increasing
regular blizzard at eve.
a.m. to East side school to see Fern Smith
wrote CE notices for papers.
Saw Gove about getting Bapt. Ch.
eve: C.S.S. Exec. Com. mtg at Chapel NIT
wrote letters to S.S. supts. all night.
Completed

Wed. Feb 16" cold very. got up at 4:30 p.m. went
to see Mrs. Watt, Mrs. Bath, Mrs. Warnock
on C.E. Union
Thurs. 17 Growing warmer.
a.m. to E.M.S. to see Miss Sears See Mrs. Fred
Warnock on C.E. business.
Eve. saw Misses Smith & Haines after prayer meeting.
Father worse in eve.  Rain most of night.
Fri. 19 a.m. called on Mrs. Watt, Mrs. Bath
and Geo. Philpott on C.E. business
Father worse at noon. Chas. has
lain on little bed in Father's room
last few nights, and been up with
me a great deal.
Sat. 19 Feb. 1898
Father passed away at 1:30 this a.m.
Chas. Marion Nette. Harold and I were
with him.  He was partly unconscious
much of time for days before, as
result of opiates given on account
of the pain. Death seemed to
be gradual, lack of breath.
Threw his arms around Charlies
neck repeatedly.
I went for Snearer immediately.
Harold & I went to Telegraph Office
sent messages to Jno. Harl & Wilder.
Charley is very much used up
Ike went to Oberlin in morning
and soon came back with Annie
and Azzie and Mayo.
Completed

Chas. went to bed 5 a.m. and staid till
noon but did not sleep any.
Irving and Azzie made all
arrangements for funeral.
Sunday Feb. 20 98. rain, turning to snow
in p.m. Only the boy went to
Church. I taught my S.S. Class.
In p.m. Harold & I walked up to
Geo. Rich's to practise hymns for
funeral. The girls want us to
sing.
Eve. We all read Bible together
after supper. each choosing a
chapter as in days of old.
Then Geo. & Bessie came in after
Church and we three practised our
hymns a little more/
Mon. 21. trees very beautiful with snow.
a.m. getting ready for funeral.
practised hymns at Miss Monroe's 10:30
Funeral 2 p.m. Mr. Cadmus read
scripture and prayed. no remarks.
Hymns "Lead Kindly Light"
Moment by Moment"
and "The Homeland."
Chas. & I Jo & Eli. Azzie & Harold
were bearers.
Completed

May Rich came down & got dinner
for us. Cora Baker drove clear up
from home, stayed all day helping
and drove back at night as tomorrow
a holiday. Abbie Brooks Fleming
came out in morning from Cleveland
and was very kind. Chas. Rich
came from Toledo.
Eve. Marion read aloud to us.
Tues. Feb. 22 trees still covered with snow.
Marion Root had to have an operation
performed on her ear last night
seems better today.
[in margin]Harl arrived 8 p.m. Harold departed midnight.
a.m. wrote S.S. Supts. Went to
see Fern Smith. stopped at Uncle
Eliab's on way back. Charley there & 
stayed to dinner.
p.m. wrote S.S. supts.
called on Mrs. Fred Warnock C.E.
Chas. to Rich's in P.M.
Wed. 23 a.m. Chas & I cleaned privy
[in margin] Harl to Cleveland a.m. Marion to Cl. p.m.
I went down town. priced beetles. etc. 
p.m. Chas & I pitched over manure
at home. a.s. Root here a.m.
Eve. Chas & I to town. he bought rubber
boots & mittens  I consulted Dr. GR.S.
Thurs 24. a.m. Chas. to Rich's. I took
notices to papers and sample to
Dr. S.   Shelled corn
Completed

p.m. took corn to mill. Harl
came over from Cleveland spent afternoon
Fri. 25. colder a.m. Chas & I to Rich's haul
manure while Geo. fixed up out tools.
Chas stayed to dinner. I down town got
2 axe handles. Flock Horned Larks in meadow
p.m. till 2 same as a.m. Then
to woods lot cutting. snow some.
Sat 26 Chas. Ely and I to woods a.m.
and p.m. Jo home in eve.
Sun 29 Took notices of C.E. Annual Mtg to Churches.
S.S. and Lake Ave. 30 present.
J G Frazer preached in our Ch.
CE Consec mtg.
Mon. 28 A.M. Harl came from Cleveland.
I stuck up posters for Annual Mtg.
Telephoned to Oberlin for Ed. Peck 15 ct
J.E. Oakes called here at noon.
[in margin] Harl left 8 pm
Start to Oberlin p.m. back again eve.
Monkeyed about and Mtg all day pm.
Eve. Annual Mtg Local Union
Iowa Male Qt sang. Address by
Wm S. Ament. Ament stayed
at our house over night.
Tues. March 1st cold nights and
thawing middle of day.
Chas & I to woods am & pm
Completed

Eve. wrote account of C.E. Mtg.
and took it to Republica. (They did
not print it).
Wed March 2 very stormy
a.m. Chas & I at George's. took up
feed cutter for him to repair.
went to Coon mill with G.
[in margin]Horne of Larks
a.m. to woods. in storm snow.
brot home feed cutter
Eve. to see Dr. got bottle of
Malt for constipation. C.E. Social.
Thurs. 3rd, Woods all day.
very cold night.
Fri 4 Woods all day, cut down the
great hollow beech. In a.m. saw
a muskrat swimming under the ice
in the ditch.
Sat 5 Ethels birthday. Woods all day
Chas. Ely & I. In a.m. Geo. R. also
trying his new saw.
Eve. to 2nd Cong. Ch. Choir mtg.
Sun. 6 S.S. & Lake Ave. Roy told me about
his father & home affairs & asked
my advice as to his own duty to
stay at home or go and do the
best he could for himself
C.E. mtg on Sabbath question Louis
Hecock lead. Eve. service at
2nd Ch. w. Roy. Wannamaker
preached on 1 Cor. 1: 22-24 "Jews
require sign; Greeks seek wisdom, we preach"
Completed

Mon 7 Mar. 98 warmer.
woods all day Chas. & I finish big beech
Robin Meadow Lark Bluebird
Tues. 8 warmer. road getting very bad.
[in margin] *
We begin going without breakfast
by vote of family.
woods all day. tough elm tree.
Robins Meadow Larks Bluebirds
Song Sparrow Killdeers
On way home went to Hill Lot & dug Salsify & Pannifer
Marion taught Miss Sears' classes in H.S. today
WWed. 9 warmer spring
woods all day. Hensons were after
a squirrell. Robins numerous
Meadow Lark. Bluebirds Song sparrows
Killdeers. Saw a small flock 25 Crow-
Blackbird flying over towards east.
Eve. started for Lake Ave. but too muddy.
Thurs. 10 Warm springy.
Woods all day.
Examinations at School.
Fri. 11. Eli not in School. did not have to take exams.
Chas. Eli & I to woods in a.m.
in p.m. a little rainy & we went to Georges, got
tools sharpened & sawed logs at his door yard.
5 Wild Ducks circled around the pong several
times & then went off. heard Blackbirds
Sat. 12 a.m. Chas. Eli. Geo. & I  to woods.
p.m. Chas Eli & I walked up to woods.
more rain, rain considerable at night.
Completed

Large flight of Wild Geese 75 or so flying
north west. Flushed a Wood cock.
Juncos.
Sunday Mch 13 1898 growing colder
Went to Church sat with Nette.  S.S.
Roy & I walked to Lake Ave. 19 present.
CE and 10 min. prayer mtg before etc.
With Roy to 2nd Church in eve. Miss Stein
sang.
Mon. 14
[in margin] Telephone put in our house.
Chas & I to woods all day.
Unlucky afternoon. Lodged a maple
tree in an oak. I went up & chopped
off the limbs. Chas. got a black eye
chip flew up & hit him. I barked my
hand. Eve. we vote no breakfast for 1 month
Tues. 15. Rain some middle of day,
Woods in a.m.
p.m. home. I called on SS. people. Brown
Dumas Richards & Tedrow. Richards
just starts for Denver Col. tonight
his father is there. Republican primary
election. polls open 4 to 8.
Eve. Exec. Com. of Co. S.S. Assoc.
4 Mourning Doves. Juncos.
Redwings
Wed. 16 Fair. beautiful
a.m. Chas & I cleaned out cobs from corn house
shelled 5 bags corn. took it to mill.
p.m. sang at funeral of Grace
daughter of August Jacobs. Went to mill
Completed

for grist. Got 1/2 bus. sweet corn ground.
Got bedding from stack. 
Eve. Marion Eli & I walked to Lake
Ave. School House to C.E. mtg. Marion led
Subj. the Pledge. Walked back with Wannamaker
& Phipps. Frogs piping
Thursday Mch 17 1898
Woods all day. Fair. warm.
Aunt Albina here to dinner
J.E. Oakes called in eve.
Fri 18 Woods all day
Sat 19 Chas. Eli & I to woods all day.
Sun. 20 S.S. Tedrow there 1st time this year.
Kay & Ella Foley & I walked to Lake
Ave: back by R.R. track.
C.E. Temperance Meeting Emmert led.
Cadmus preached on Filthiness & foolish talking
Monday 21. Equinox. rain a.m. Chas &
I stayed home. swept cellar. Tore
down old chicken house. p.m. to
woods. Eve. to see Dr. Sherwood
Marion & WE Miller talked of
swapping houses.
Tues. 22. a.m. Chas. & I to Rich's
sawing oak tree in east pasture.
p.m. walked to woods. Horse
lame. Phoebe
Dandelions. Spring beauties. Ground nut
Completed

Wed 23 Mch 98 colder
horses left hock very lame & swollen.
Chas & I picked out all the saleable
potatoes in cellar; 10 bus. Rural
N.Y, and 4 bus Early Puritan
and sold them at the Andover? Hotel
at 60 cts a bu.    $8.40
Marion went to Oberlin in p.m.
Baby all well,
Thurs. 24 a.m. to woods. walked. horse worse.
pm. sang at funeral of Hiram Patterson
sawed up old boards in wood shed.
Fri. 25 woods all day. Fair. frost
Eve. Junior Exhibition Eli also
Ralph Fay & Cora Baker.
Annie & her Marion here to dinner
Annie and Jo here in eve. to
Junior Ex.
Sat 26. Chas, Eli, Ike & I woods all day,
walked up. horse very lame.
Winter Wren.
Sun. 27. rain S.S. Frank Duneas 1st time this year
Roy & I walked to Lake Ave. Miss Sears went on wheel.
24 present. Review.
C.E. Consec. meetg.
2nd Church in eve. with Roy.
Mon. 28. rain some in a.m. Went to see Dr. Maysey
about horse. bandaged leg & put on hot water.
p.m. Chas. Eli & I to woods.
Vacation.
Chewink, Juncos.
Completed

Tues. Mch 29 cooler.
Chas Eli & I to woods all day.
Horse no better. Kids kept up the
hot water treatment all day.
Eve. C.E. Social.
Wed 30. Work at Hill lot.
Opening up old drain on flat.
sawing up dead larch trees
Eve A.& A here. Also Geo. Rich & family
called after attending Waldo Shepard's wedding.
A & A are going to Germany in the
summer & want Net to go too.
We boys ate supper all alone Net & Marion
sup at Chapel. We played "buz"
Thurs. 31. Hill lot all day.
trim trees & clear up.
"Right" (Jersey heifer) to Rich's bull
Helped Geo. get a load of truck from
Bobb's house.
Marion & Net invited out to supper.
Hot water treatment kept up on the
horse until tonight. Sore "broke" last
night. Pus runs out all the time.
Fri. April 1st. 1898 Eli sick. stomack.
Chas & I hill lot trim trees.
Azariah & France here to dinner
Sat 2. a.m. I went to Chapel to send off Cuban Relief
but could not find the things. Wrote S.S.
letters.
p.m. hill lot north end. Chestnut tree.
saw Jo on Electric car. he went to Lorain
Completed

with a crowd of Oberlin fellows. stopped
home 2 minutes in eve. on his way back.
Sun. Apl 3. 1898. ground white w. snow in a.m.
S.S. Lake Ave. alone. Roy went to
Coonville S.S. to visit. They want him
there for supt.
Was asked to sing in our Church male Quartette
this eve. Harry Davies sick.
Miss Slaughter of Santee Agency spoke
at C.E.
Mon. 4. a.m. went to Chapel & packed barrel
of clothing etc. for Cuban relief work
took it to freight depot in wheel barrow,
p.m. Hill lot trim at south end,
Election day. colder in p.m.
Tues. 5  Very cold. Keyes promoted at School.
a.m. Chas & I shell corn 6 bags. I went
down asked mill to come & get grist for
us. Went to freight depot.
p.m. Hill lot finished trim trees.
Eve. Exec. Com. Co. S.S. Ass.
Jo came. candy. He found my
Golden Rules for me.
Wed 6. Hill lot. cutting up apple limbs etc.
got 2 settings of eggs from Geo. & set 
2 hens.
Walter Davies called in eve. about practise.
Net to Oberlin in p.m. back in eve.
Thurs 7 a.m. Geo. hauled manure from 43
to hill lot. 2 wagons running.
p.m. Chas & I to wood lot. looked over the
Completed

meadow & began trimming apple trees.
Eve. choir practise
Fro. Apl 8. 1898 good weather. roads good.
horse still lame.
a.m. wood lot. trim trees,
noon. Harold arrived from Chicago.
I borrowed Will twins horse to bring up
his baggage.
p.m. wood lot.
eve Choir at Dr. Sherwoods
Sat 9 a.m. Chas. & Eli to wood lot. I stayed
home. do odd jobs & took Harold's
baggage to depot. He left at noon
for Lockport N.Y. where he speaks Sunday.
Then goes to N.Y. to sail for Venezuela 
on the 16th.
p.m. all to wood lot Eli & Ike Chas & I.
eve. Choir. Bank for Chas. bought a
white shirt for self. 75 ct. and a pair
of pants for Chas.
Sun 10. Easter. Sang in Church Quartette for
Henry Davies. S.S.
Lake Ave. 28 present. Foley to Coonville.
C.E. Belle Faxon led.
Sacred Concert.
Mon. 11 Wood lot. trimming. In p.m. stopped
at Geo. for him to mend clippers. I hitched
up team & plowed while he did it.
Eve. calls inviting SS. kids here for Tues.eve.
Baker, Lozier, Yesberger, Plocher.
Robins begin to built nests. G C Kinglets.
Completed

Tues. Apl 12, 1898. fair. warm.
A.M. went to mill & got 500 lb ham
cut off ash limbs in lane
p.m. wood lot trimming.
On way home talked with Aunt Albina & Mrs. Twiss.
Eve. S. S. class here at 43. and
Roy Foley's class also. 21 kids. all
my boys except Lozier & Tedrow.
Marion gave them warm sugar and 
dough nuts. pea-nut hunt. buzz,
sing hymns etc.
Wed 13. clouding up.
trimming all day. Rode up in p.m.
horse does not go lame, but leg
is very big & Stiff. Brought home
tools from woods In p.m. I painted
the scars, on apple trees.
1st ship launched at Lorain today.
Thurs 14 a.m. I stayed home & got bedding from stack
p.m. hill lot, Geo. plowing at South end.
we dug the parsnips, cleared up bushes
& trees along south fence & burned them
and hauled 2 loads wood.
Roads dusty.
G C Kinglets. Adder tongue in blossom.
Chas. cut down English Streak Apple tree after supper.
Fri. 15 a.m. wood lot. Chas. trimmed
I painted scars.
p.m. Chas & I painted scars at hill lot.
home early & cut up Eng. Streak tree.
Geo. plowing & sowing oats, hill lot..
Completed

Sat. Apl 16 1898.
a.m. Chas. Eli & I burning brush
at wood lot. Geo. finished
sowing 2 acres oats. S. end hill loy
on shares. Plowed some at N. end.
p.m. All kids at hill lot planting
potatoes N. end.     Brought
home load of wood
Sun. 17 slight shower in a.m.
S.S. and Church.
Eli & I rode to Lake Ave. Stopped
at Sears' and hitched up their horse
for Miss Sears & Miss Stein.
Eli taught class of boys.
C.E. meetg. Sang Haven of Rest. flunked
2nd Cong. Ch. to Gospel Song Service.
Mon. 18 shower in a.m.
Chas to farm all day. Rich's to dinner
I home all day. Put up old shed for
the summer. Clearing up in lane
etc. Down town in p.m. to see 
about printg programs of S.S. Conv.
Ruby Crown Kinglet. G.C. Kinglets.
Cherry & Peach blossoms. also Jap Quince
apple leaves partly out.
Tues 19. colder rainy.
Work at So. S.S. business all day.
notices to papers see Miss Starr.
direct envelopes etc.
Completed

Wed 20 Apl. 98
Geo. hauling manure from 43 to hill lot.
two wagons. Chas. loaded wagons. Geo & I haul.
I was at Geo's to dinner.
Thurs 21 Geo. finished hauling manure.
9:30 till noon I mailed the programs
of SS Conv. to Supts.
p.m. Chas & I to Wood lot trimming.
Eve. prayer mtg led by C E pres. Bess Haines
after it went to Disc. & Bapt Ch and
called at F H Stark w. programs.
Got some eggs at Geo. and set a hen
Fri. 22 a.m. Chas to Uncle Eliabs. expects
of go to Kas. monday
Geo & I got load cinders at Shear Fac
to W.W's & load manure to Ensigns.
p.m. we help Geo. fencing.
Eve. Chas & I to Oberlin on electric.
Sat 23 rain all day.
sprouted potatoes
p.m. called at Will Lozier. not home.
Eve. Marion & Jo home from Oberlin.
Sunday 24 cloudy cold.
Sermon on Balaam. S.S.
Mr. Hults' first Sunday at Lake Ave
19 present. appointed Com. for Anniversary.
C.E. Cons. Mtg. prayers for the boys* who
are going to war. Walked home w. Jo
Completed

Monday Apl 25 98. cloudy cold.
20 boys from Elyria started for war.
farewell speeches by ministers etc. at
Andover?. big crowd see them off.
Letters from Wi. Chas not going to
Kan. immediately.
Chas & I help Geo fencing.
Barn Swallows. RC Kinglets
Pear tree blossoms.  Chippy.
Eve. to see Dr Sherwood
practice for Memorial Day at GAR Hall
Tues. 26 helping Geo. fencing all day
Saw Sparrow Hawk attack a robin in meadown.
Eve. brought dozen eggs at Muzzey's
set 2 hens one in wood shed with home eggs
one under bench in barn with Mussey eggs
Wht throat sparrow.
Wed 21 frosty morn. fair
finished Geo's fencing. 
brot. home rest of wood from hill lot.
Eve. Duplicating a letter at Cadmus
office. Chas to E.W.s in eve.
Told him to go at Kan. in morning
Thurs 28 slight frost, fair
Chas left for Kansas on 5:30 a.m. train
Geo. & I fixing fence at our wood lot.

 Eve. Meet of Reception Com. for CE Conv.
House wren
Completed

Fri. Apl 29 '98 threatening
Geo. & I finished fencing at our wood lot.
Eve. planted peas at home.
We have 20 chicks hatched.
Directed 175 envelopes for A.M A 
collection.
Sat. April 30 fair warm
Geo. Burnham helped me trim
apple trees wood lot. $1.50 on his
pasture bill.
Eli hauled ashes outo pasture at home
cleaned out ash bin
Vireo. Bobolink. Chimney swifts.
Marion came home from Oberlin
Sun. May 1. 1898 Marions 39 birthday. hot
Church : A.M.A. Collection. I am committee
S.S.   Lake Ave. started to walk
out (Bell lame) used Sears' horse.
25 present. Eitam & Roig.
C.E. in Court house basement.
Church & Chapel entirely pulled down,
Evening Ch. Sounod Concert.
Baltimore Orioles
Mon 2 a.m. rain.
worked for Geo. all day planting potatoes
and setting strawberry plants.
Brown Thrasher
Summer Yellow Birds. Letter from Horace
Great Naval Battle yesterday at Philippine Is.
U.S. victory over Spain.
Completed

Tuesday May 3. 1898 cloudy cooler.
work for Geo. all day plant potatoes.
Wed. 4 cloudy.
a.m. hauled manure on to home garden.
trimmed trees in garden. burnt
brush piles etc.
p.m. Geo. plowed our garden.
Thurs 5 rainy drizzle all day.
a.m. fixed pasture fence at home
10 a.m. Marion & I to Bank. got the
$3000. Insurance money
p.m. looked over Fathers garden seeds
fixed fence. Shelled corn
turned Black & Right out in orchard
Fro. 6. cold clearing
Co. S.S. Conv. at Lorain all day & eve.
Saw Mrs. Bacon Mother of Lou & Laura
Riding home at night on car we sang War Songs.
Sat 7. cold clearing more. I went to Lorain
again all day.
a.m. Kids burned brush at wood lot
Geo. harrowed our garden at home.
News came of Dewey's official report of
battle in Philippines. 11 Spanish Ships destroyed
no U.S. ships disabled. no U.S. men killed
p.m. Kids worked at home.
Completed

Sunday May 8. 1898 cold. fair.
Church and S.S.
Miss Sears & I to Lake Ave. 19 present.
Net led C.E. subj. our denomination.
Eve. service on Patriotism. Report announce
that Sampson had defeated Spanish fleet
on Atlantic & taken Porto Rica
Mon 9 fair warmer  front in night
a.m. sold pie plant 23 ct asparagus 10 ct.
got seed drill from Go. Sowed beets
and carrots on middle land of garden.
p.m. W 1/2 S land 2 rows at N parsnips.
then a row W part onions E part Salsift.
Eve. Miss Jennie Gould called. wants Quartette for C.E. 
Mildred Day here.
8 Quartette practise for Memorial Day.
Report of last night not confirmed.
Tues 10 warmer. rain some in p.m.
garden at home. all day. plant potatoes
etc. spade flower garden. transplant ash tree.
Rose breasted Grosbeak singing
Wed 11 warm. good shower in p.m.
a.n. Wood lot. paint scars. Then
carry brush. Barnham had worked another 
day trimming.
p.m. rain. fixed poultry yard fence.
eve. called on Mrs Porter for AMA Collection.
Quartette at 8 GaR Hall.
Kingbirds
Thurs. 12 a.m. finish poultry yard. cut R. NY potatoes
p.m. burn brush wood lot. Geo. Burnham
Completed

said we would turn his cow in tomorrow
Crested Flycatcher.
Eve. called n Jim Brown.
Quartette. GaR Hall.
May 13 98
a.n. plant 2 rows potatoes E 1/2 S. land.
C.E. Convention (Lorain Co) Disciple Ch.
Misses. Black, Birdseye, & Hinman of Oberlin entertained
at our house.
p.m. after Conv. plant 1 row beets W 1/2 S land.
barn brush in grove.
Hide-nest hen has 9 chickens
Other hen has 10.
Eve. to Conv.
First female Oriole
Sat May 14 Sunrise Mtg. CE Conv 6:30 Eli & I
a.n. Eli Nelson & I to wood lot. burn brush.
p.m. Eli Keyes & I "    "       ". Burnham
finished trimming. We finished burning
brush and painting sears. All done
Trees in full bloom. 
On way home stopped at Hill lot. Trim up
an evergreen tree. Potatoes just coming up.
Ike began taking care of Musseys cow
he is to get $5.00 a mo.
Our cows in pasture this p.m. 1st time.
Scarlet Tanager male & female.
Sun 15 Orchard Oriole   cloudy.
S.S. John Tite there.
Lek Ave with Hults. 26 pres.
I taught, boy. "        made speech
stirring up.
Completed

C.E. Temperance Mtg Miss Gould led.
Decoration Quartette sang "Brightly beams".
Hults there & spoke of "Good Templars."
Eve. sermon on Joshua.
Mon May 16  warm rain. p.m clear
[in margin] Letter from Herald from Hayti.
a.m. tried to use Mimeograph, failed.
Uncle E W telephoned me to come & see him.
Spoke to Jackson about fat cow.
p.m. Louis Hecock took some Gladioli and
gave us some pansies & daisies.
Weeded out the asparagus beds, & peas,
trimmed some pear trees.
Why throat Sparrows.
Tues 17 fair colder at night
[in margin]  Irving arrived from Kansas lame 2 crutches
hauled out manure from hen house and 
planted squashes, melons & cucumbers in
along middle of South land. Planted 
sweet corn SW and NE parts of S land.
Spaded round bed where bon-fire was
near oak tree and put on hen manure
& planted 7 hills watermelons. after
supper made prison coup for setting hens.
8 pm. Male chorus for Decoration day.
Wed 18 frost? pm S wind warm rains 
a.n. garden & plant radishes peas &
Coffee beans. Marion went to Medina
State Assoc. Cong. Ch.   Uncle EW brought
printed Metcalf Genealogy.
p.m. Help Geo. plant corn. rain.
Eve. took Right to Bull.
Wood Peweee
Completed

Thurs. May 19 1898. rain. warm.
a.m. took yellow cow "Henrietta" 
to wood. lot pasture. brot back
load stove wood & 100 straw berry
plants. Split wood.
p.m. Sang at funeral of Henry Rimbach
called for Garford's ama money & other errands
split wood.
eve. Geo. Rich here after prayer mtg.
Fri 20 rain. hot. Annie here to dinner
[in margin] Cuckoo Red headed W.p.
a.m. prepared ground and set out
strawberry plants planted Bush Lima
p.m. sang at funeral of Mrs Adams
mother of Mrs Stough, Carlisle Rode out on
Electric car. Did our practising, out on side hill by old river bed. Spading.
Eve. Male chorus. Ice Cream Soda with Chas Lord.
Sat 21 hot showers.
all of us work in garden, spading
picking out witch grass roots, plant
string beans. trim quince bushes
& black currants. dig up hyacinths
set out gladiolus. Chop up apple limbs.
Eve. cut Ike's hair.
Sunday 22 Rumor of naval victory at midnight
Big racket.  warm. no rain.
S.S.  Lake Ave. 31 present
C.E. voted to send flowers to Cleveland
once a week.
Eve. service Lorain Cong. Choir
Mrs. Farrell sang "Prodigal Son"
Completed

Monday May 23 1898
a.m. start plant corn for Geo. but
too wet. Cultivated our potatoes at
hill lot. Geo. plowing at hill lot.
p.m. Geo & I plant corn for him.
Tues 24 
finished planting Geo.'s corn.
sang at funeral of old Mr Jerome
at 10 a.m. Vesper Sparrow nest 4 egg
Marion sold our house & home
to EK Mussey & SB Day for $10,000.
We can live here 6 mo. longer.
eve. practise for Memorial Day.
Wed. 25 fair cooler.
a.m. Geo. harrowed our corn ground at 
hill lot and I planted corn.
p.m. finished plant corn, trimmed
off evergreen limbs.
Eve. led Lake Ave. C.E.
Bute has calf.
Thurs 26. Moysey here to clean bute.
her bag caked. kicks when
milk her. spent most of a.m.
monkeying with her. work garden.
p.m. helping Uncle Eliab make
out deed to Mussey & Day.
Eve. M.E. Ch. prayer mtg.
Fri 27 a.m. went to see Geo. about plowing,
then work in garden.
p.m. to Register's Office. Made an Abstract
of Title to our home place for Mssrs
Completed

1898
May

            Mussey and Day.

Eve. practise for Memorial Day.
Sat 28 Sat. a.m. all kids to Hill lot
hoeing & bugging potatoes.
burned brush from evergreens.
caught in rain in p.m.
Annie & 2 kids here to dinner.
Jo. came 9 p.m.
Sun. 29 Bapt Ch. late.             S.S.
Old Mr Bryant went to Lake Ave
for me. I sang at Memorial 
Day.
Led C.E. Mtg on Xian Growth.
Mon 30 Decoration Day.
a.m. Called on Carrie Hamilton at office
and delivered Sec. & Treas books & papers of 
Co.S.S. Assoc.     Garden.
Ike & Nelson work garden. Eli, Keyes and 
Jo to Oberlin with wagon load of books
etc.
p.m. Sang at Memorial services at Open House.
work in Garden. Eli home 5 oclock
Yes 31 fair cold night, hot day.
planting corn for Geo. at our wood lot
he putting it in on shares
Geo. plowing at wood lot.
Eve. Roy, Miss March & I rode to Coonville.
A.J. Reid began series of meetings
there.
Completed

Wed. June 1st 1898.  hot
a.m. finished planting corn on
south strip East of ditch at wood
lots.
p.m. cultivated home garden
3 p.m. to wood lot planted corn on
north strip east of ditch,
S strip was marked one way. took more than a 
whole day to plant. N strip marked both
ways. only took 2 hours to plant.
Eve. to Lake Ave.
Thurs. 2. hot
a.m. hoe corn & squashes in garden.
put hellebore on currants.
p.m. after school Ike Keyes Nelson & I went
to hill lot. planted Rural N.Y. Potatoes. 5 rows
East side of flat.
Eve. to D C Baldwin's & EWM's on A.M.A. bus.
Fri. 3. hot. a.m. picked over the little
potatoes for planting. Went to Bank
and sent off A.M.A. money.
p.m. Ike (got excused from School after first
period) and I to hill lot plant potatoes
13 rows on flat. Early Puritan
Eve. to Lake Ave. practise for Anniversary
Miss Wingate here.
Sat 4 a.m. all work in garden till 9:30
I went to Sears' to practise my solo for tomorrow
p.m. Eli Ike & Keys to H S Field Day . Nelson
& I  (& Gene Corell) to hill lot. Plant
Completed

1898
4 rows beets 1 row carrots on flat
Nelson planted pumpkins in corn.
Hoed potatoes.
Eve. Eli & Ike swimming
Sunday June 5. Communion service.
Pearl Hoyt Fuller Mr & Mrs Tulk, join Ch.
Collection for Educ. Soc.
S.S. only 4 boys, spoke of joining Ch.
Lake Avenue. 24 Anniversary. Ike and
Mr. Bryant rode down with me. very dusty.
eve. late to Meth. Y.P. mtg. roll call
Eve. sermon by Cadmus on David.
Mon. 6. hot. a.m. cultivated home garden
sowed onion see w. drill. p.m.
flower garden Summer Day had city-
surveyor here. told me not to
count on south strip.
Eve. to Oberlin to conference of C.E.
workers of County.
Tues. 7 a.m. planted salsify & parsnip
on flat at hill lot. Cultivated the
potatoes there. Blain borrowed drill.
p.m. set out tuberoses
Wed 8 Harls Wedding Day
Planting potatoes for Geo. Rich
staid there to dinner. p.m. heavy
rain. cutting potatoes. Peddlers.
Eve. set out cabbage plants.
We telegraphed congratulations to Harl.
Completed

Thursday June 9" 1898. hot.
a.m. transplant squashes melons & cuc's
a couple hours then to Geo.'s plant
potatoes all day. there to dinner
Keyes there in p.m. helping.
Eve. Called on Brow, Tite and
Becker.
Fri. 10. rain rain rain.
a.m. set out tomatoes East 1/4 of
N land. Then to hill lot set out
56 cottage plants on flat.
p.m. weeding in garden. picking
over beans for seed,
Eve. new Exec Com. of C.E. met
to choose committees. present Miss
Maria Lickorish, Haines, Phipps,
Sutlief (Ruby). Mssrs. Foley & Metcalf.
Roy & I sat on verandah lounge till late.
Sat. 11. a.m. Ike & I put paris green on
hill lot early potatoes. put it on
dry with lime. Eli & Keyes weed
carrots. p.m. weeding in garden
Roy here to talk w Marion & ask advice.
Eli mow lawn & went to Oberlin 4:40
to spend Sunday with Jo.
I mow grass n & w of house
Sun. 12 Childrens Day. Cadmus preached to
children. No S.S. Lake Ave. 21
present. Big rain during S.S.
Bapt. Y.P. mtg. roll call. Cadmus preached on
Jehoshaphat.
Completed

Monday June 13. 1898 Rain.
S.N. Day here early. Said surveyor was to
meet him here. but did not come on acot of rain.
Began work on drain (sewer) for his street,
at river. Said he would have to tear down
pasture fence & we must get cows out of 
the way. Also if we want the grass on South
strip must cut it now.
a.m. to Geo. grind scythes. etc.
p.m. to wood lot. fix fence. down at
East end. by Hensons.
Crelly puts horse in wood lot tomorrow.
Tues. 14 a.m. Geo. mowed grass South strip.
Mary Wis came from Wellington
" and Nelson and & I went to 11:22
train and met Harl and Rena.
p.m. A and A & France and Jo here.
tremendous rain. I cocked up the
grass just in time. Kids went in
shower bathing.
Eve. sat in porch. sang.
Wed. 15 Work in garden. hauled in jag
of grass. Standin borrowed wagon.
Eve. Eli went to Uncle Eliabs to see 
about buying a Geneva bicycle.
I got letter from Deming Investment
Co. about a position at Oklahoma City.
Had a letter Monday from Irving
about it. He recommended me to them.
Completed

Thurs. June 16. a.m. Answered Deming's letter.
Eli & I haul jag grass.
garden. p.m. sang funeral of child
at Lapp's. Took Mary to CL & W
station 4 oclock. Harl & Rena rode over
there on their wheels.
Eve. called on Lozier (Mr), Fred Ingersoll
and Frank Dumas.
Fri. 17 a.m. cultivated corn at hill lot
Harl & Rena came up there on wheels.
p.m. garden. H & R to Oberlin. back in
Eve. with Jo.
Sat. 18 a.m. to hill lot finish cultivating corn, brought
cultivator home & cultivated carrots etc.
9:40 Big Family Picnic to Lake. All of us
except Net who works at Library. Uncle Eliabs folks
& Geo. Richs folks & Lizzie DeWitt. Went
down on Electric car. Glendennings Beach. Swim.
Sail boat. Ship yard. I came home at 4 p.m.
to do chores & Jo to go to Oberlin.
Harl & Rena to O in eve. to spend Sunday.
Sun. 19 SS. only 5 boys. Lake Ave. with Miss
Sears only. 17 present. Teachers mtg after.
Roy Foley led C.E. Eve. sermon on Judas Maccab.
Mon. 20 a.m. plant potatoes for Geo.

             p.m. "         "           "    " Then cultivated

potatoes at hill lot. caught in
slight rain.
Killdeers nest in potato field 2 eggs
Tues. 21 a.m. hoe potatoes hill lot.
p.m. down Lake Ave. w Harls bicycle
Completed

called on Biersbach, Haag, Higgins, Dellafield,
Wells, Mattison, Gerber.
O.S. Nichols bought the White face
cow "Henrietta" for $30.00
Eve. called on Yesberger & Rice.
Wed 22 a.m. cult. corn wood lot for Geo.
p.m. trim hedge hill lot.
letter from Deming Inv. Co. got another
man. Eve. H.S. Commencement. I
did not go. Joe here to see about
getting work on new church.
Thurs 23. a.m. trim hedge hill lot finished
p.m. cultivate potatoes      "  "     flat.
Mary Wi here. John Carrie & Franklin
arrive from Alabama. Harl & Rena
from Oh. in eve. Call on C. Plocher
Fri. 24 a.m. Mow grass w scythe.
SB Day begin plowing street. His
man & I move pasture fence.
10.20 a.m. Big Family Picnic
Electr. cars to Roots. A. & A join.
dinner in Roots front yard. Swim 2
Mary left early 4 p.m. for Wellington.
Eve. Alumni mtg. Harl sang. didnt go
Sat 25 a.m. [in margin] Harl's birthday 31
Eli & Nelson pick potata bugs
at hill lot. Franklin & I plant 
beans at wood lot. Great rain. we
went to Hadaways house.
p.m. Eli & Ike finish bugs
I plant 1 land beans.
Keyes went to Aunt Sarah's for week.
Completed

Sunday June 26 1898
S.S. General Review conduct by Marion
very fine. Harl sang "Who will run with
the Tidings." Lake Ave. Mrs. H. Ammon
rode down with me 26 present.
Carrie Norton there.
C.E. Consecration Mtg.
Eve. sermon (?) on Destruct. of Jerusalem.
Harl sang "the mistakes of my life are many."
a favorite hymn of Father's.
After Ch. we talked & sang at home till
11 oclock. good.
Mon. 27 cult. corn for Geo.
8:30 a.m. Whole family up to Hill
lot to select building site
I Stayed at Rich's to dinner. Wm A. Bowen
& wife & Spencer of Honolulu, D.C. 78 were
there. Great rain in p.m. Geo. &
I went into house & listened to Mr. Bowen
talk & then studied on plan for our new
barn. Eve. barn plans. W.S. Allen here.
Tues. 28 a.m. met Allen at Hill lot &
staked out barn 18 X 26 ft. Dug
potatoes where barn is to be. Shelled corn.
p.m. Eli & I to wood lot. I plant
beans. then both cut suckers off of
apple trees. trimmed whole orchard.
Then to hill lot & bugged potatoes.
Eve. C.E. business mtg. too late. called on
Henry, Lozier, Dumas, Murbach
Completed

Wed, June 29 1898 hot.
a.m. cultivate at hill lot.
Allen has 3 men &  2 teams excavating
for the barn. Eli cultivating
at wood lot w. Geo. he stayed to dinner
at Geo.'s.
p.m. Geo. mowing at wood lot orchard.
Eli mow w scythe.
I sang at funeral of Henry Ingersoll's baby.
then worked garden. John to Wellington
on wheel.
Eve. took flowers for Cleveland hospital.
Thurs. 20. a.m. Ike & I to hill lot cultiv. potatoes
plant beans, sweet corn & cucumbers, hoe beets.
Eli to wood lot w. Geo. mow w scythe.
p.m. John Eli Ike & I wood lot. Geo. finish 
mowing among trees.    mow with
scythe rake & cock that wh. was mowed first.
Terribly hot. Eve. called on Brown & Tite.
Friday July 1. 1898 very hot
a.m. hoe garden till 9 then all 
to wood lot mow, cock & turn & bring
home load stove wood.
p.m. rake & cock rest of hay. then to
hill lot. cut a little wheat & dug a few
potatoes near barn.
Sat 2 [in margin] hot
hauled the hay in woodlot orchard & sta cked
it. Then all but John to hill lot hoe potatoes
last part of p.m. Jo home in Eve. Marion
treated us all to ice cream at lawn fete
Completed

given by Mrs. Bairds S S Class for benefit
of soldiers. John & family to Oberlin.
Sunday July 3. very hot
only 2 boys at SS.
19 at Lake Ave. 4 p.m. Laying of corner
stone of new Church. C.E. "Honoring
parents." Roy & I to Episc. Ch. in eve.
Mon. 4 cool. Jo & Roy tramp to Fort Lot.
Eli & Nelson to Lake on elect. cars.
Ike walk to Lake. All back to supper
bringing Keyes. I worked in home 
garden. Spanish fleet destroyed
Tues. 5. a.m. go to Oberlin.
Eli Ike Keyes & I hoe potatoes. John arrive.
p.m. John & I cock hay for Geo.
Eli Ike & Keyes hoe potatoes
Wed. 6 a.m. Eli Ike Keys & I hoe potatoes 
John cock hay for Geo.
p.m. John & Eli & I " " " Geo.
Ike & Keyes hoe corn
Thurs. 7 a.m. Eli Ike Keyes hoe corn
John & I 'haying for Geo.
p.m. Geo. cut our wheat Eli & I
set it up. All of us haying for Geo
until 3.
Eve. called on Dennis, Dumas, Henry, Lozier.

Fri. July 8 1898 haying for Geo.

Eve. swimming in 40. Roy with us.
Sat. 9 Rain in night.
a.m. John & Eli help Geo. put 1 load hay in Allen's
barn Keyes & I to wood lot cultivate beans. then
hoe at hill lot. Ike home.
p.m. cultivate home garden. Then John & I went 
up & set up wheat for Geo.
Sun. 10 only 4 boys at S. S. 25 at Lake Ave. 6 boys
C.W.  Y.M. Committee mtg.
cool day.
Mon. 11 cool a.m. hoe garden at home
p.m. John & Eli  on bicycles to Oberlin
Ike & Keyes to hill lot hoeing.
I mow for Geo. with scythe.
When milking spoke to Ike about C.E.
Eve. to Fred Reeves' to practise Quartette for
West Side Con. Social.
Tues. 12 Geo. John & Eli haying for E.W. in p.m.
Ike & I at hill lot all day working at barn.
filling in dirt around basement.
John & Eli turn hay for Geo a.m.
eve. called on Griswold & Becker.
Wed 13 all haying for Geo all day.
eve to Miss Sears to practise Quartette
Completed

Thurs. July 14. hot again.
all of us work for Geo. haul wheat.
two wagons, John load. Eli pitch on.
I pitch off, Wilmot pass bundles
Geo. stack. Ike cock hay.
Fri. 15. all haying for Geo. finish S.E. lot
2 loads big big barb 2 small loads to Allen & load

well shed 1 load horse bar.   1 on wagon.

Eve. to Lawn fete by 2nd Cong. C.E. Quartette sang.
Sat 16 a,m. cultivate potatoes at hill lot till Geo.
came along with his load of hay then help
him put it into Will Gates' barn. Then home
dig potatoes in garden.
p.m. put up the 2 acres hay at wood lot
in stack for Geo. On way home Geo.
treated the crowd to ice cream.
Eve. called on Will Bell.
Sun 17 4 boys at S.S. Hults & I to Lake Ave 15 pres.
big rain at 12 m. & drizzle
C.E. Missionary mtg. very few. Harry Breman there
YM Com. mtg.
Mon. 18 a.m. rain early. river high. Ike "shooting rapids"
with Reno Mussey. Eli & I work garden, weeding.
p.m. to mill. got 4 bus. oats $1.40 (ours are
all gone) and 200 lbs bran. see Dec. 20
and Apl 12. Collected $25 from Nichols for
cow. Then home. work garden.
Eli went to see Harry Bramen. candy. candy.
Annie & France here. Eli picked the Actraean apples 1/2 bushel.
Eve. called on Rollin Griswold.
Completed

Tues. July 19. 1898
a.m. Eli & Ike & I help Geo put off & load hay &
then to hill lot. I cultivate flat. Eli work
in barn cellar.
p.m. work Garden. tie up morning glories etc.
kids mow lawn.
Wed. 20 Eli & I work at barn cellar all day.
Ike got load kindling & hoed.
Thurs. 21 Eli to Lake w. SS. class & to stay at
Aunt Sarahs. Ike & I hill lot. also in a.m.
Keyes & Nelson. kids hoe, I shovel dirt.
Eve. called on Plocher & Foley.
Fri. 22 Geo. cut oats at hill lot, a.m.
John set up. I cut corn where house 
is to be.
p.m. Marion to hill lot to boss staking out
house. Geo. cut oats. John & I set up
John to supper at Richs.
Eve. Ike & I to Mrs Bairds C.E. Committee on
lawn fete
Sat. 23 monkeying at hill lot. cut some more
corn. Ike dug 1 bus. potatoes. Kids got
kindling. finished cleaning out barn basement
Allen staked out the house.
Sun 24 2 boys at S.S. 2 good showers in
middle of day. 21 at Lake Ave.
good C.E. Meeting Howard Foley stood up.
Completed

Mon. July 25
a.m. Ike & I work in garden
p.m. "   " "  dig potatoes. Kids pick
up. Eve. sort potatoes. Eli take Nette's trunks
to depot. Quatette serenade Mr. Benton.
Eli home from Aunt Sarah's 6 p.m.
Tues. 26
Eli Ike Keyes & Nelson to S.S. picnic 8:15
Jo home 9. John makes Ice cream.
Jo & I sell 3 bus. potatoes & go to
hill lot to see barn etc.
A. & A & family here 11 a.m. dinner immed.
They and Nette take 11:56 train
Start for Europe. We all & Aunt Albina
and Wilmot & family and Augustus & Lucy at

p.m. dig potatoes alone. Jo to Oberlin.
Eve. stuck up pasture for Lawn fete.
Wed 27 a.m. all digging potatoes

            p.m.   "     "     "                John

also for part of time. Geo & I
set the oats over 2 X 2 It was

Stone work on new house rushing,

Eve Quartette at Reeves'

I cultivate flat Then all hoe
flat p.m. all hoe until rain
Big rain 3 p.m.
Eve. prayer mtg. John let Galatians II

Fri. July 29 1898
a.m. sold 8 spring roosters to
Laundon for $2.60
Down to Fay Muftrg. Co. in response to a letter which
said they might have a position for me.
p.m. picked early pears. tree at
SW corner chicken yard. 3 bus.
Then John & Eli to Oberlin on
bicycles. I made more

Eve. Quartette practise at 43

to hill lot for corn fodder

p.m. put the strawberry
plants in pots.
Eve. lawn fete. Jo came

sermon on "Newness of life'
7 boys at SS.
Lake Ave on wheel 34 pres,

Tues. Aug 2. 1898
a.m. all to wood lot hoe beans till 10 a.m.
then to hill lot set over oats.
p.m. hoe beans till 3 p.m. then to hill lot
hoe potatoes. John to Oberlin on wheel.
Wed. 3. Joe came on 7:00 car.
7 male persons to lake on picnic. went
to Monroe cottage where Marion & Nelson
have been for a week. good time.
Keyes Nelson & I walked up beach past Lake Breeze

Marion & Nelson home with us.
Thurs 4 a.m. we all picked & picked over beans
peas for dinner. Then to hill lot. fixed
a plot for strawberry plants. hoed potatoes.
p.m. took   "              " up there & set
them out. then hoed potatoes
Eve. prayer mtg.
Fri Aug 5 Ethels Wedding Anniversary
a.m. hill lot. kids hoe potatoes
I set over oats.
p.m. kids W & I "  "  "
I laid tile drain in basement of barn
eve. killed 3 hens & helped dress them.
shut up more young roosters.
a.m. sold 9 roosters to Laundon $2.30
John & family to Oberlin a.m. back in eve.
Sat 6. a.m. Eli & I hoe potatoes. Nelson & Jene
Corell monkey. Ike Elderberrying with Fowl
p.m. John Eli Ike & I help Geo. haul oats
John & I to Geo.'s to supper, late.
Completed

Sunday Aug 7 1898.
John preach on "Blessed is the man
that feareth the Lord." I taught
3 or 4 S S classes doubled up.
32 present at Lake Ave. decided on picnic
for Wed. Roscius G. led C.E.
Went to Meth Ch in eve with Louis Hecock.
Mon 8. rain all a.m. wrote letters to Horace
and Leon. p.m. to hill lot after
corn fodder. & put slug-shot on cabbages.
Then forked over manure pile.
Eve. Missonary mtg. address by blind
Mr. Riggs of Turkey on Publication dept. of
Misnry work.
Tues 9 sold 3 1/2 bus potatoes  1.35
all of us kids pick pears Tyson
tree out by pasture. Sold 3 bus
at Fisherville 50 cts a bus.
p.m. pick pears. finish the tree.
Eve. call on Becker and spoke to
S.S. Rockwood on street about Fay Co.
Wed 10 Lake Ave. S.S. Picnic. Randalls Grove
Ike & Nelson drove me don to the School house
7:30 a.m. & I went with the crowd. At
night I walked back from school house.
On way called on Jim Brown.
Thurs 11. a.m. Eli Ike & I opened oat Geo.'s oats.
I went up to John Miller's on bicycle to
see if he would take our Tyson pears to
Cleveland p.m. We began hauling oats

for Geo. and a great rain stopped us.

All of us pick pears Tyson tree by garden

a.m. work in garden

then back East to Murray Ridge, then north

on Murray Ridge to RR crossing, then afoot

a.m. sold 1 bus. Tyson pears.
at Fisherville. All us kids
picking over elderberries in wood-

John helped Geo. haul a load of oats

p.m. all kids to hill lot, plant turnips.

a.m. went up to see Geo. about hauling dirt

p.m. All to hill lot. incl. John. rain.

Eve, prayer mtg. rain

a.m. Eli Ike & I 17 loads p.m. Eli John & I 18 loads

Sat Aug 20 hauling from barn yesterday

p.m. Eli Ike & I    13  "

Sunday 21 Jo taught my S.S. ckass
Quartette drove to Brownhelm
to Cooly's funeral. started 9:45
back 4:15. Then sang for Old
Mrs. Mallory.
C.E. Japanese lady spoke.
Saw Sam Bacon & Misses Ruth
and Lizzie (?) Bacon. Peaches and
dinner at Will Bacons.
Mon 22 hot
a.m. T. Farmer hauling dirt from barn.
Ike Eli & I shoveling
p.m. hauling dirt from Early's 14 loads
eve. Elyrian Quartette to Oberlin on 7:40
car to do some serenading. back
on 11:10 car
Tues. 23. hauling dirt from Early's
a.m. Tom Farmer with 2 wagons
Eli Ike & I shovel. began late 12 loads
p.m. Geo Rich & T. Farmer. 2 wagons
John Eli & I shovel. 32 loads
Carrie & Franklin to Oberlin p.m.
Completed

Wed. Aug 24 1898
a.m. working at Earlys. T.F. & 2 wagons. Eli
Ike & I shovel. stopped by rain.
p.m. John also. tremendous rain in middle 
of p.m. Home. wrote letters to Chas.
Eve. patched my rubber boot.
Thurs. 25. a.m. Wrote letters to Nette etc.
p.m. all shovel dirt or rather mud.
Fri. 26 shovelling all day. had some trouble
in a.m. getting a 2nd wagon.
Eve. to a social gathering at Mr. J.W.
Young's on Lake Ave. Geo. Rich took
9 nine of us down. bed 1:s.a. standard.
Sat 27 shovelling all day. John p.m. only
Mrs. Franklin Post here to dinner
Eve. called on Wm. Dennis & wife to
see son Robert.
Sun. 28 S.S. 5 boys. Lake Ave, with Roy and
Miss Sears. Birthday box started. 36 present. 7 new scholars.
C.E. mtg. Plocher boys join.
Mon 29 Shovelling at Early's
a.m. 12 loads. p.m. 11 loads
quit at 4 oclock on acct of big
thunder storm. Mow in front yard.
Eve. Write letter to Harl
Tues 30. Family Picnic to Aunt Sarah's
Got up on spur of the moment.
Telephoned to Oberlin for Joe
We 6 boys took 9:20 car John Marion
Carrie & Franklin later. Weather perfect.
Coming back all except John Carrie
Completed

Franklin & Nelson walked to Lorain. Home
at about 6. Joe went back to O.
Wed 31 a.m. pick tomatoes & bartlett
pears at home. 
p.m. John Eli & I on bicycles
to Oberlin. I rode Carrie's wheel.
Eli & I visited Joe at Library while
John did errands. Coming home
my tire gave out. Had to push
wheel half way.
Thurs. Sept. 1 Thrashing day.
Eli Ike & I help Blaine thrash
8:10 a.m. Then Geo.
Our wheat 13 bushels
Our oats    40  ""
Fri. 2 a.m. Eli shovel at Disciple Ch.
Geo. haul dirt from there to hill lot.
I put wheat in house except 4 bus.
which I took to mill. Ike & I
took 19 bus. oats & put in bin
at new barn. Then went to
see John Miller & Waldo Shepard
about buying our bartlett pears.
p.m. Ike & I shovel at Disc Ch.
John & family leave for South
big rain 6 p.m.
Sat. 3. a.m. all of us shovel at
Early's. 8 loads
p.m. all pick bartlett pears
Completed

at Woodlot. 13 bus. Waldo
Shepard came around & loaded
them in his wagon. he will
take them to Oberlin Monday.
Eve. Called on Yesberger (not at home)
Griswold & Will Bell.
Joe came home.
Sun. Sept. 4'1898 Rain hard in a.m.
Our church resumed morning services
in Opera House. Only 3 boys at S.S.
62 in whole school. (rain) Lake Ave
25 present. C.E. room full.
Union service at Bapt. Ch. Cadmus preached.
Mon 5. A.M. All work garden. hoe turnips
etc. sell tomatoes & corn.
p.m. hill lot hoe turnips & strawberries
Marion & K & N walked up.
Eve Marion read Independent aloud.
Tues. 6 School begins. rain a.m.
Waldo Shepard came. He only sold
10 baskets of pears. Gave us $1. We
gave him the rest of the pears.
I mended pasture fence. Ike & I
to Geo. sharpen scythe and bring home
rest of the oats.
p.m. gather flower seeds & pull 
weeds in garden.
eve. called on Rice boys.
Completed

Wed. Sep. 7. 1898 Nette's Birthday. 25 yrs.
much cooler
a.m.pick tomatoes. pull weeds.
p.m. pick Lima beans. dig Iris bulbs.
eve. pick flowers for C.E. Write letter
to Nette.
Thurs. 8 Cold night. fair warm day.
a.m. began working on drain at new
barn when Geo. came & wanted me to
help shovel dirt at Ch. Finished the
job.
p.m. A.C. Benedict rep. Herrenden Mfg Co.
Steam Boilers here. 3:30 Nelson & I to hill
lot. I work on drain.
Eve. called on Brown. saw John Tite on
street. Went to Andover?  kitchen to se
Will Brown and to Topliff kitchen to see
Jim  ".
Fri 9 Worked on drain at new barn all day.
Eve, C.E. business mtg. talk of raising
$300 to furnish S.S. room for new Ch.
Sat 10 Wilder's birthday.
a.m. & p.m. Eli & I cut corn at hill lot
Ike Keyes & Nelson hoe.
eve. practise singing for funeral of Mr. J.B. Winney
killed by cars.
Sun. 11 My Birthday 27 yrs old. They celebrated
it with peanuts & candy and everything.
Nette & Annie sent me a little photograph of
"Ilsenfalle" at Ilsenburg. Eli and Marion
gave me a good pocket knife. Beaut. day.
Completed

S.s. Lake Ave. with Roy & Miss Sears
Temperance Lesson. I gave Spider web talk.
On way back Miss Sears treated us to water melon.
6:00 practise singing for funeral.
C.E. mtg Mr. Cadmus gave out 5 ct pieces to be
invested & brot in with usury for new Church.
Mr. Knapp preached on Hid Treasures & Pearl of Great Price
Mon. Sep. 12. 1898.

  a.m. Miss Hall 1/2 bus. tomatoes

Marion decided on steam heat for new house.
Cut corn 3 hrs.
p.m. funeral of Mr. Winney at Bapt. Ch.
Hair cut and singed by Ed Brown father of Jim.
Talked with Walter Notley.
Eve. Called on Yesberger. talked with Carl,
Tues. 13. a.m. finish cutting corn at hill lot.
then work on drain at new barn.
p.m.  "      "     "      "   "    "
Wed 14 Ike's birthday 15.
a.m. worked on drain.
p.m. went to Geo.'s to sharpen tools 
for cutting hedge & finished the
drain and cut hedge a little.
Eve. Birthday celebration. Joe
home 6 p.m. car. Paper. Candy.
Chocolate kisses, grapes. Reading
aloud.
Thurs. 15. Last picnic of the year.
To Aunt Sarah's Mario Joe Eli & Ike
Keyes Nelson and  . Walked both
Completed

ways between Lorain and Root's. Mayo
stayed down there.
Eve. Prayer mtg. and business mtg
of S.S. teachers, discuss finance
lesson systems etc.
Fri. 16. Eli & I and Geo. haul load of 
hay and load of straw to Gates'
and one load hay from stack at
wood lot to our new barn.
Ike Keyes & Nelso pick beans at wood
lot.
Sat 17 a.m. another load to new barn and
one on wagon. kids finish picking
beans at wood lot.
p.m. load of hay at barn at 43
kids pick beans at hill lot. We put
all the beans in attic of new house.
Kids hoe. I cut hedge.
rain in eve.
Sun 18 S.S.
Lake Ave. Boys sign Temperance Pledge.
took my Birthday offering.
C.E. Ike's name proposed for active member.
Evening service at 2nd Cong. Ch. Sermon on
Ps. 103. 3-5 Who forgiveth, healeth redeemeth satisfieth
Mon 19 a.m. pick tomatoes, sold 1/2 bus. Hill lot to trim
hedge but Art Coon came along & I came home
to show him the pears. and he would buy them.
Joe (just home from Lake) and I pick pears on
tree SW corner of orchard. p.m. pick pears.
Completed

Eve. Quartette at Miss Sears' to practice.
Tues. Sept 20. a.m. Joe Ike & I to wood lot
get Seckel pears & wind fall apples.
Then I chop old boards in wood shed all
the morning. Coon came for the pears
at noon. 21 bushels. Seckel Duchess &
Puckery $4.20.
p.m. Joe & I look over new house
I cut hedge. Joe & Eli to Oberlin
on bicycles. Joe took Fannie Roots
wheel to O. for her.
Wed. 21 Equinox cold night. fair warm day
Cut hedge all day. north end Hill lot.
Eve. Quartette at Miss Sears.'
Thurs. 22 rain rain all the morning. Pitch
manure and chop up rubbish.
p.m. write letters to Walt. Richards. went to
see Jno Miller about renting potato digger.
stopped at Earlys on way home.
Eve. saw Jno. Tite and Jim Brown.
Fri 23 rainy. did nothing but monkey in
the house. Red. S.S. work. Set desk in
order. Scrap book. etc.
Eve. The Family Paper. and plate of candy.
Eli went to stay over night at Aunt Mallie's
she is alone. Uncle Eliab in Kansas.
Sat 24 rainy. a.m. drove Marion up to new house.
Eli & I began taking up the wire poultry fence.
p.m. candy after dinner to celebrate France's
birthday, Geo Rich here, asked for my account
of work for him. We finished poultry fence
Completed

Eve. called on Howard Foley.
Sun. 25 Rally Day.
Marion supt'ed S.S. gave a general Review
2 new boys in my class 11 in all.
Lake Ave. Association Day. Ike went
with me and spoke a piece "Assoc. Day Ode.
Harris Oldfield rode down with us.
33 present. C.E. Ike joined as an
active member. , Even. service at 2nd
Cong. with Roy.
Mon. 26 Cutting corn at wood lot with
Geo. Rich and Frank Freeman. Mrs.
Wilford gave us a watermelon.
Eve. Quartette at Miss Sears'.
Tues. 27 Cut corn at Wood lot with
Geo. Frank and Willie Salzman. finish.
Got some fodder from hill lot.
Eve. Quartette at Philpott's store.
Wed. 28 a.m. cutting corn for Geo.
p.m. engaged two colored men to shovel
tomorrow. help Geo. pulling beans.
Telegram from Irving asking me to 
come to Lawrence at once for
3 mo. work in Oklahoma.
Supper at Glendennings Pavilion at
Lorain with Roy Foley, A.A.H. Williams
Miss Sears Miss Levagood & Miss Jackson.
Thurs. 29. a.m. work for Geo. haul load household
goods from depot to Carlisle. haul beans.
haul bbls. water, etc.
p.m. shovel dirt at Earlys with the 2
Completed

2 colored men Walter Johnson & Lou Brown.
and W. Salzman. showers. hot.
Eve. Quartette at Sears'. Miss Jackson there.
Fri. Sept 20 Shovel dirt at Earley's all
day.
Eve. The family paper." Mildred Day
here. also Ralph Fay bringing a
letter from Caleb Lawrence describing
tour in Palestine.
Chas. Rich in town.
Sat October 1sr
Shovel all day. one hour in a.m.
carried water from river for men who
are making cistern at new house.
Up stairs nearly all plastered.
Kids pick beans, dig few potatoes,
pile up kindling wood in cellar.
Eve. Choir mtg basement of Caust. hs.
Sun 2 Church. new Chorus Choir. Horner
leader. S.S. Gus Terry new.
Lake Ave. w. Miss Sears. pick up Harris
Oldfield again. 31 present. hot
C.E. & Eve. service. Miss Clark of Oberlin sing.
Mon. 3 a.m. Shovel dirt at Earlys with
Johnson & Brown. p.m. shovel at
Carl Oppers new cellar. 21 loads p.m.
Eve. Quartette at Sears 8:30
really hot
Tues 4 Rain in night and rain all day.
a.m. chopped 9 sawed up old boards
p.m. read magazines. Wrote out an
Completed

account of our supper at Glens Beach
for the family paper.
Eve. Good Templars Conv. Quartette
sang 2 pieces and "Dried apple pies"
for an encore. Griswold, Reeve, Carpenter.
Wed. Oct 5. not cleared off yet.
a.m. sharpen knives on little grind stone
To hill lot for corn fodder. water
everywhere.
p.m. chop up boards etc.
cut up quinces for Marion.
Thurs. 6. cloudy. cold.
a.m. decide not to haul dirt. helped
Geo. fix fence w. side of meadow west
of wood. 4 hrs.
p.m. cleaning up in cellar of new house.
Fri 7 unsettled. cold.
shovelling dirt at Opper's cellar. 
Eve. "The Paper."
Sat 8. a.m. began work in the rain shovelling at
Opper's cellar. finish it before 10  a.m.
Col. Kramer at hill lot figuring on the 
grading. brot. home some stalks.
p.m. All kid to hill lot cleaning up the
kindlings & cellar. Mr. Crisp look at buggies.
Eve. Choir mtg. go. came.
Sun 9 Mrs Byrner spoke at Morning service
and at S.S. Miss Gaylord
of Oberlin sang. Mr. Horner at
our house to dinner 31 at
Lake Avenue. Gates Gardner
Completed

1898
led C.E. mtg on Patriotism.
Eve. sermon on "Why could not we
cast him out."
Mon October 10 cold night. warmer.
a.m. got load of furnace wood.
p.m. fixing drive way behind the
new barn.
Eve. called on Baumner Young
and Harper.
Tues. 11 rainy
a.m. read Independent. went down to see
the new Church.
p.m. read "Water babies". picked late pears
at SW corner. 1 1/2 bus.
Eve. Choir mtg.
Wed 12 cloudy. cool.
a.m. down town & got 6 bushels charcol
$1.50, a wheel-barrow $1.25 and a 
curry-comb .15 Then to hill lot. Geo
& I filling the cistern filter. got
gravel from river. p.m. finished
filter & cleaned out the cistern.
pounded stone on drive way behind barn
Marion told Geo. to do our grading.
Eve.to Sherwood's to practise my solo
with Mrs. Cadmus.
Thurs. 13 cloudy. Marion to Cleveland to
Woman's Ohio Missy. Cong. Conv.
a.m. painted the wheel barrow
p.m. chopped up boards.
eve. Annual Church business mtg.
Completed

I was elected committee on Collection for
A.B.C.F.M. Then to Sherwoods to
practise solo.
Fri. 14 cold. rain. took Marion to new house
a.m. & p.m. monkeyed
Eve. The Paper.
Sat 15 cold. a.m. chop boards. Ike pick
grapes on ash tree in front yard.
Eli got chestnuts in grove.
p.m. hill lot. Eli & I dig potatoes
Ike got walnuts & picked up "
Eve Choir mtg. my solo
Sun. 16 Sang solo "Oh for a closer walk with God"
at Morning service. S.s.
Lake Ave. 27 present. Beautiful weather.
C.E. & eve. service.
Mon 17 Dig potatoes all day kids pick up after school. warmer.
Tues. 18 rain rain rain. Big fire last night. Linseed
Oil Wks. a.m. pick over potat
in new barn. monkey in new house.
p.m. took Marion to new house & Geo.'s
Then to Crisp & Henson's where she bought
a new buggy for $45. & sold the 
old one for $10. & the lumber wagon
for $5. Bought padlock for new
barn & took it up there.
Wed. 19 a.m. up to hill lot for some sweet corn
took the old wagon and buggy to
Crisp & Hensons and brought home
Completed

The new buggy.
p.m. dig potatoes at hill lot. Horse
Belle fell down hill.
Eve. called on Davis, Lozier, Dumas 
& Henry.
Thurs. 20 Oct. warmer
a.m. dig potatoes
p.m. help Geo. grading at new house.
Aunt Mallie & Edith up there.
Eve. prayer & teachers mtg.
Fri. 21 rain rain rain.
a.m. pick over potatoes at new barn.
p.m. down town in rain. tried to sell
a bushel of pears unsuccessfully. Left
buggy tugs at Haserodts for repairs.
Mended old buggy cushion. Wrote for
the Paper on "The Old Buggy"
Eve. the Paper. Roy Foley here. rain.
Sat 22 rain. cold.
a.m. put in window panes in kitchen
chopped up boards. p.m. Marion Eli
Nelson & I to new house. Got some
corn fodder, all down town, got the
buggy tugs $1. and whip 20 cts.
Eve. Choir.
Sun 23 cold fair Ch. & S.S.
to Jail mtg instead of Lake Ave.
Miss Clarissa Lawrence talked at Jail.
Roy to L.A. for me in our new buggy
Called for Will Bell to go to C.E.
Miss Little spoke at C.E. and
Completed

at Eve. service in Micronesia.
Miss Keller sang.
Mon. Oct 24 warmer. & wind.
dig potatoes a.m. & p.m.
mended my rubber boot
eve. C.E. Social for members only.
Tues. 25 fair dig potatoes all day
Eve. called on Beckers
Wed 26 cold a.m. dig potatoes all day
eve. called on Beckers
Wed 26 cold. a.m. dig potatoes
p.m. much colder. rain and snow
pick over potatoes in barn.
delivered 3 bus. to J. Freeman.
H S. Seniors went on Geology Excursion
& "froze to death."
Thurs. 27 cold, snow in corners did
not melt. a.m. chopped boards
p.m. dug potatoes
Eve. Prayer mtg & teacher's business mtg.
Fri 28 hard frost, mud froze. punkin vines
killed. a.m. to hill lot for sweet corn. See
Geo. about digging another cellar for Opper.
dig potatoes. p.m. dig potatoes. Kids
come up after school Ike Keyes & Nelson
to pick taties and we got in some
of the squashes & punkins.
Eve. crack nuts for Joes birthday
Sat 29 beaut day. frost. but warm sun.
all kids dig potatoes, finish early's
& begin on Rural N.Y. 
Eve. Choir. Joe came home. Eli & I
met him at car. "Paper."
Completed

Sunday Oct 30 1898 Joe's 18th birthday
church. sermon on prison reform.
S.S. Lake Ave. 33 present. decided
to form a new young peoples class.
C.E. Cons. Mtg Eve. service. I flunked
on solo "Holy holy holy" from Spohr's
Last Judgement.
Mon 31. a.m. dig Rural NY potatoes
p.m. same. Ike Keyes & Nelson up
after school to pick up.
Eve. Marion & Ike to Halloween Social
at Geo. Rich's
Tues Nov. 1.
a.m. pick green tomatoes, wheel w p
old boards from grove. pick grapes.
p.m. see Lou Brown about shovelling
dirt tomorrow. finish digging our
potatoes. Deliver 4 bushels to
Freeman.
Eve. C.E. business mtg and Choir
meeting.
Wed. 2. begin digging cellar for Opper to
get more dirt for grading at new house.
Lou Brown & I shovel 9 hrs.
Thurs. 3. shovel 9 1/2 hrs. Lou & Bert Brown load
wagon & I shovel dirt under porches etc.
at house. Eve. nit prayer mtg.
Fri. 4 a.m. shovel 5 hrs. all 3 of us load
wagons. finish the cellar.
p.m. brot up 248 bbs bran from Mill
Completed

got some straw from Richs. chopped
kindlings Eve. 2nd Cong. Choir at Sears.'
Sat. Nov. 5 1898. a.m. all of us pick apples
at home. Onstine and Grindstones all
the only apples we have. Dug bulbs.
rain 11 oclock.
p.m. Eli Ike & I sort potatoes at new
barn. rain rain.
Eve. Choir,
Sund. 6 Wanamaker preached for Cadmus.
S.S. 28 present at Lake Ave. Y.P. class
started with 2 scholars. Foley teacher. Xmas.
Eli led C.E. mtg.
Sacred Concert in eve. Fred Demuth, Fullerton
etc.
Mon 7. a.m. hauled up mantel & grates & tile
etc. for new house from freight depot.
Went to wood lot for pick apples. none there,
p.m. help Geo. get a load of hay from
his stack at our wood lot. brot home
furnace wood.
Tues 8. a.m. help Goe. get hay from stack.
brot home furnace wood.
p.m. ditto ditto. hauled load of wood
for Geo. while he went to centre to vote.
I voted Prohib. State ticket and Repub. County.
Wed 9 rain rain rain.
sort potatoes
Thurs. 10 a.m. pitch over manure. chop. boards.
rain pm. took Marion to new house in new
Completed

buggy. Sort potatoes.
Eve. prayer mtg. Address by Fushida (?)
a Japanese studying for Missionary.
Teachers mtg. colder.
Fri. 11
p.m. delivered 5 1/2 bus. potatoes to
Jno. Freeman. Went to Foleys house on
Gates St. and then took Roy to see
our new house. Shovelled dirt
at new barn.
Eve. The Paper. Mary Wi came.
from Kansas.
Sat 12 Eli & I help Geo. Rich dig potatoes
all day. Ike picked
apples for Geo. some. Mary
went to Wellington.
Eve. Choir.
Sun. 13. Ch. S.S. 10 boys. Lake Ave.
appointed Committees for Xmas.
C.E. Eve. service. rain some
feet sore, chilblains.
Mon 14 a.m. chop wood. broke up old
refrigerator. p.m. got horse
shod. bought felt boots etc.
rain some.
